directions: It's on the main Jawatta Road strip, right after Ceilao Villas.
name: Fenghuang Lou

description: Majestic City's new dessert stall serves up some decent ice cream, along with some other sweet treats at affordable prices.
directions: MC's right at the Bambalapitiya Junction. Go down to the basement for icecream. It's kinda opposite the Pizza Hut stall in there.
name: Frozen (MC Foodcourt)

description: Amaage is probably the largest restaurant in the area. They do decent kottu.
directions: If you're heading towards Point Pedro's beach, this is just before the junction where the shopping mall is, onto your left.
name: Amaage Restaurant (Point Pedro)

description: As the name suggests, roast paan. Stuffed roastpaan.
directions: It's in the same building as Sugar Shack down De Fonseka Road.
name: Tosakanth's Roast Paan

address: No. 34, New Galle road, Idama, Moratuwa.
directions: Just 10m from Moratuwa cross junction in Galle driving direction.
name: Steam Boat (Moratuwa)

description: Small and underwhelming, EEAT is okay for a chinese roll and woodapple milkshake.
directions: From Thurstan Road, turn onto Flower Road and it's to your right about 100 meters in.
name: EEAT

description: Indian Spice is a low-key Indian restaurant that shares the premises with the equally modest, yet somewhat dodgy China Town. The place may give out a slightly dicey feel, but the food actually isn't half bad with a pretty legit butter chicken.
directions: Sea Avenue on Galle Road is near Nations Trust Bank and The Fab. Indian Spice is on the street's Marine Drive end.
name: Indian Spice

description: Pugzy's Kitchen is a home baker catering to our furry four-legged friends. Offering nutritious and tasty treats in pretty packaging, this is a fresh, welcome alternative to the unhealthy, dried snacks available at supermarkets.
name: Pugzy's Kitchen

description: Solid ol' Saiva Kade in Jtown.
directions: It's almost right opposite the Sri Nagavihara International Buddhist Temple.
name: Aakshathai

address: No. 46 A, D. S. Senanayake Mwt. ,Colombo 08.
directions: In Front of the Super market.
name: Upawansa Hotel & Bakery (Borella)

description: Mirage Colombo's restaurant with Chef Lloyd's signature pizza, fish and chips and intercontinental fare.
address: 61, Moors Road, Marine Drive, Wellawatta, Colombo 06
directions: It's just after Dinemor if you're heading from Bambalapitiya. Or before, if you're coming from Dehiwela.
name: Platinum Pier

description: Mid range conveyor belt sushi at Arpico's Urban Kitchen.
directions: On the right hand side of the Union Place entrance of Arpico Supercentre.
name: Poppy Hana (Urban Kitchen)

description: The Galle Fort's charming new boutique property
directions: It's right next to the Galle Fort Hotel.
name: Church Street Social (The Fort Bazaar)

description: Sells rotti, with sliced bananas and Kandos chocolate in the middle. They also have Lassi.
address: 36 Light House Street, YMBA Building, Fort, Galle.
directions: Walk down Light House street, you can't miss the YMBA building.
name: Fort Rotti Restaurant

description: Owned by the Ceylon Hotel Corporation, the Grand Ella has a great view, okay service, and mediocre food.
directions: From the Ella Junction, walk towards the general direction of Wellawaya. The Grand Ella is a few minutes away from the junction, onto your right.
name: Grand Ella Motel

directions: In front of the Pelawatte Sampath bank
name: Jungle Juice (Pelawatte)

description: Ice cream lovers rejoice! Il Gelato is back on Duplication Road. They've moved to a smaller location than their previous outlet, but the gelato is still as good.
address: R A De Mel Mawatha, Colombo
directions: IL Gelato is on Duplication Road, right opposite Queen's Cafe before the turn off to Queen's Road.
name: Il Gelato (Duplication Road)

description: One of the island's oldest and grandest colonial properties.
directions: It's in the heart of the Galle Dutch Fort, impossible to miss.
name: Amangalla

description: The Black Cat Cafe serves up amazing sandwiches, coffee, and fresh fruit juices. They're also a B+B.
directions: It's on Wijerama Mawatha just between Ward Place and Rosmead Place. If you're heading in from Ward Place, it's onto your left.
name: Black Cat Cafe

description: Meat & Co. is a home cook who grills some decent steaks at very reasonable prices
directions: The road is almost directly opposite Savoy in Wellawatte.
name: Meat & Co.

description: An authentic and casual Japanese revamp of Work In Progress. Worth a try.
directions: It's immediately at the main entrance of the Dutch Hospital opposite the World Trade Centre. At the former WIP premises.
name: Ikoi Tei (Dutch Hospital)

description: Bakes by Bella has come a long way, from starting off as a little home baker to now having a full-blown delicatessen at Alfred House Avenue. They serve up a fantastic brunch menu in addition to a bunch of new treats up for grabs.
directions: It's a bit of a maze, but head on into Alfred House Avenue and they're on the left side of the main lane.
name: BakesByBella

description: This is a somewhat eccentric cafe with great music, interesting decor, and somewhat mediocre food.
directions: If you're walking down Hospital Street, keeping the Dutch Hospital premises onto your right, go straight ahead and take the first turn right, and then the first turn left.
name: Serendipity Arts Cafe

description: They have a variety of dishes including Sri Lankan, Western, Arab, and Chinese.
directions: If you walk into Church Street from Rampart Street, it's a few metres in onto your right.
name: Boutique Cafe

description: Calorie Counter's now in Pelawatta and with it they've introduced a bunch of new healthy dishes and desserts.
directions: Calorie Counter is just past the Pelawatta junction, opposite the Department of Examinations.
name: Calorie Counter (Pelawatta)

description: Beard Papa's is an international franchise which specializes in cream puffs. The first outlet opened in Japan in 1999.
directions: It's situated in the Arpico Supercentre premises, and shares space with Urban Kitchen. Turn right soon after you enter UK.
name: Beard Papa's (Urban Kitchen)

description: Licensed to Grill is a food stall which whips up wraps, burgers, and a couple of grilled items for super reasonable prices.
address: George E de Silva Park, Dalada Veediya, Kandy
directions: It's a stall at Torrington Park, right between the Kandy Clock Tower and the Lake. If you're walking towards the clock tower, it's soon as you pass the White House restaurant, onto your left.
name: Licensed to Grill

description: Natural Coffee is one of Kandy's most popular coffee shops. They also have macha tea/ milk.
directions: It's in the same area as the entrance to the Dalada Maligawa. You can't miss it if you walk towards Temple Street with your back to the lake.
name: Natural Coffee

description: August By Mama Aidas is the newest addition to Colombos Middle Eastern restaurant repertoire. With authentic dishes, exceptional service and a chic, relaxing setting, August looks like its here to stay.
directions: August is at the same premises as Shirohana Petal Guru on Dudley Senanayake Mawatha, just passed the Lamborghini showroom on the opposite side of the road.
name: August by Mama Aida's

description: Icebair is a small, underrated, Swiss-owned outlet in Negombo with a great, rustic atmosphere.
directions: If you're heading north along Lewis Place, it's about a five minute walk before the Golden Star Beach Hotel. It's a few metres past the hotel if you're heading towards Colombo.
name: The Icebair Restaurant

description: Serving up waffles out of a food truck, Bencita On Wheels is a convenient take-away option if you travel through Dutugemunu Street.
directions: It's on Dutugemunu Street. If you're coming in from Pamankada it's to your left, if you're approaching from Kohuwala junction, it's to your right.
name: Bencita On Wheels

description: Sandwich Factory does a filling take  on western diner favorites.
directions: It's the road adjacent to the WSO2 building on Duplication Road.
name: The Sandwich Factory (Colombo 3)

description: This is a new buth kade off Havelock Road, near Thumulla. It's basically average.
directions: From Thumulla Junction, head down Havelock Road. It's the second lane on your right, you can park there usually.
name: Rasa Bojun

description: Mirissa seems to love its roti, and no one does it better than No.1 Dewmini Roti Shop. It's a small, family-run restaurant that offers an impressive variety of dishes, along with some of the best savoury and sweet rotis we've had.
directions: Turn into Udupila Rd from Matara Rd. Travel in about 200m and take the first lane to your right (you'll see a small sign there). Take the second right on that lane and you'll find the roti shop.
name: No.1 Dewmini Roti Shop (Mirissa)

description: The Noodle Monkey is a new cafe on Haig Road by Don Stanley's group. While their food has its merits, they've tried to do too much with the menu and the entire operation lacks direction.
directions: Heading from Kollupitiya, go south on Marine Drive. You'll pass the Bamba rail station and Majestic City (Station Road). It's the fourth street after that.
name: The Noodle Monkey

description: Nestled among the Torana shops on Galle Road, this little eatery serves up a good fried rice, a hefty chow mein, and quite a range of juices.
directions: It's opposite Colombo Jewellery Stores on Galle Road.
name: The Red Pineapple by Torana

description: The Silver Spoon is a quality buth kade in Ratmalana that serves wholesome food at decent prices. (Steer clear of the meat, though)
directions: The Silver Spoon is in Ratmalana on Galle Road, before the Maliban Junction, next to Five Star Bakery.
name: The Silver Spoon

description: Nelum Kole is a rice-and-curry kade in Boralesgamuwa that provides a convenient and cost-effective lunch spread.
directions: It's near the Boralesgamuwa Lake. You can take High Level Road to Maharagama and loop back around, or take the 120 bus road and turn onto the Maharagama Road. Go till you get to the Lake and turn down a little lane near the end. Look at the map.
name: Nelum Kole

description: In Doo Se is an Indian Restaurant situated in Thalawathugoda. It's a wonderful place to enjoy a pure Indian meal with a good service.
directions: Turn left from the Borella - Kottawa Road to Nugegoda Road from Thalawathugoda Junction & keep going for about 150m. In Doo Se is in front of the Keells Super Market.
name: In Doo Se Restaurant

description: The aptly-named Flamingo House is the newestand probably funkiest addition to Colombos restaurant repertoire. The food is inconsistent but interesting, but the excellent cocktails and crazy interior win brownie points.
directions: Heading up Horton Place, it's past the Coffee Bean and on your right just before Wijerama Mawatha, right behind Gerard Mendis Chocolatier.
name: Flamingo House

description: Reef House Cafe is a small shack of a restaurant on Mount Beach. It's got an undeniably dodgy feel to it, but the food isn't terrible and they do serve booze. That plus the fact that they're open well into the night makes this a popular spot for a meetup.
directions: The easiest way to get to Reef House Cafe is to turn into Siripala Rd from Galle Rd, and come all the way down to the beach.  Reef House Cafe is to the right as you enter the beach.
name: Reef House Cafe

description: Though reliable, the tiffin hut doesn't have the tastiest food in Fort.
directions: Passing the Old Dutch Hospital head up York Street. GOH is at the end.
name: Tiffin Hut (Grand Oriental Hotel)

description: So Mirissa's got their own Beach Wadiya (though not associated with Colombo's Wadiya). They offer a decent variety of seafood with an emphasis on the day's catch. The execution, however, was inconsistent.
directions: From the Udupila junction, head straight down to the beach. It's along the beach stretch, next to the Mirissa Eye restaurant.
name: Mirissa Beach Wadiya

description: Cake Whisperer is yet another good Colombo home-baker. They do simple, sweet cupcakes mostly - some of the best butter-cream frosting ones we've had.
name: Cake Whisperer

description: Montage would have ranked as ok chinese seafood until I uncovered something inside the dish.
directions: Trek it down Siripala Road, right opposite Mount Grill. You can't miss it right at the bottom.
name: Montage

description: Red Orchids is like the new Flower Drum, with the same staff and waiters, and again they do tasty classic Sri Lankanized Chinese food at affordable rates.
directions: Castle Lane is near the Bamba flats, almost opposite Shakthi Institute. Head down here to the Marine Drive end and you'll see it on your left.
name: Red Orchids

description: Red Snapper is a seafood restaurant at the Dutch Hospital that does a range of crab and lobster preparations. It's a formal dining place that plays a lot of '90s saxophone music and serves OK food.
directions: It's just around the back of the Dutch Hospital, next to the Shamrock bar and lounge and near the green bricked Economic Museum.
name: Red Snapper

description: Il Ponte at Hilton is one of the older Italian restaurants in Colombo. It may not be as popular as it was back in the day, but their Italian fare is pretty solid all-round.
address: 2, Sir Chittampalam A Gardiner Mawatha, Colombo 01
directions: Come along Galle Road past the Galle Face Green, turn right at the Kingsbury roundabout and make your way to the Hilton. Il Ponte is located by the poolside on the ground floor.
name: Il Ponte (Hilton)

description: Shandong is a new Chinese restaurant in Rajagiriya, spearheaded by a few Industry veterans. They're one of the better choices when it comes to Sri Lankan Chinese delivery, though certain areas have plenty of room for improvement.
name: Shandong Chinese Restaurant

description: The sushi bar at the Cinnamon Lakeside lobby is actually a great place for an authentic Japanese meal for very affordable prices.
address: 115, Sir Chittampalam A Gardiner Mawatha, Colombo 2
directions: It's between Lake House and the Air Force Headquarters.
name: Cinnamon Lakeside Sushi Bar

description: Flavors is Galadari Hotel's Indian restaurant. Their food is actually pretty decent, but the ambience, or rather the lack of it makes you want to wrap up your meal as fast as possible.
directions: Flavors is located at the back of the main lobby area on the ground floor of Galadari Hotel.
name: Flavors (Galadari)

description: The Kandos Shop is a super cheap, one-stop-for-all candy shop, featuring one of Sri Lanka's oldest chocolate brands. It's an ideal stop for kids and gift shopping.
directions: It's just a minute from Dinemore and Olive Garden, next to the Vijitha Yapa bookstore.
name: The Kandos Shop

description: Shahla's Baked Bliss is a home baker who specializes in jars full of toothsome goodies. It's not too pricey and her jars and brownies are top notch.
name: Shahla's Baked Bliss

description: Pilawoos, the biggest players on Colombo's kottu scene, have set up a bigger, more family friendly restaurant on Marine Drive. The kottu and iced milo are still stellar.
directions: Turn into Palmyrah Avenue from Galle Road (it's two lanes after Barefoot), and you'll find it on Marine Drive on your right.
name: Grandpila Family Restaurant

description: Kami Maki is one of two Japanese delivery spots in Colombo. The sushi may not be the best in town, but its not too bad and the delivery is fast and reliable.
name: Kami Maki (Delivery)

description: The Chariot, most popular for their branch in Dehiwala, is an accessible and affordable stop for baked goods and rice and curry.
directions: It's a minute from the Bambalapitiya Flats, opposite Shakthi Institute.
name: The Chariot (Bambalapitiya)

description: Hotel de Majestic is one of the oldest kottu-and-biriyani stops on the Bamba Galle Road stretch. It's a popular and easily accessible stopover for biriyani and a quick cold drink.
directions: It's right opposite Majestic City, amidst the kades next to MD Gunasena Bookshop.
name: Hotel de Majestic

description: Chinatry is an Sichuan Chinese restaurants.  The punchy, spicy flavors are authentic but still good for the Sri Lankan palate.
directions: Chinatry is at the corner of Flower Road and Green Path. Coming down Green Path, turn right.
name: Chinatry

description: This Japanese stopover is a wonderful addition to Negombo's popular stretch of restaurants. The food and service are great and they've got a sushi conveyor belt in the evenings.
directions: It's right next to Cafe J and  the Jetwing Blue hotel, a few minutes from the Rodeo pub.
name: The Sushi Bar (Samurai)

description: Olive Garden is another one of Colombo's many Chinese restaurants. The food is good and affordable, and they've got private rooms if you want to take a big crowd with you.
directions: It's right at the cross between 5th Lane and Thurstan Road, before the Flower Drum takeaway joint.
name: Olive Garden Restaurant

description: The Tangerine is a gem of restaurant hidden away in Balapitiya at Calamansi Cove by Jetwing. As far hotel restaurants go, this is one of the best we've tried in recent times. Delicious food, beautiful presentation and good service.
address: Wijerama Temple Rd, Balapitiya, Sri Lanka
directions: The Tangerine is at Calamansi Cove, which is at the end of Wijeramam Temple Rd, less than a 1 km from the Balapitiya bus dept and the Jumma Musjid.
name: The Tangerine (Calamansi Cove)

description: Terro's Pies and Roasts is a home cook in Dehiwala that bakes some tasty pies and serves up some hearty roast meats. As far as home cooks go, we'd say she's a great pick for savory dishes.
name: Terro's Pies & Roasts

description: Cafe Beverly is a comfortable, affordable dining space in the premises of the Beverly Street shopping complex in Rajagiriya.
directions: If you're heading towards Rajagiriya from Battaramulla, it's just past KFC and before Keells Super.
name: Cafe Beverly

description: Smokey's is a home baker that specializes in delicious brownies at easy prices - and they happen to be completely vegan too.
name: Smokey's (The Brownie Bar)

description: This basic buth kade serves a good rice and curry and sorta specializes in baabath (tripe - ie cow stomach).
directions: From the Slave Island junction (where Burgers King is) head down Malay Street towards Fort. This place has no sign or name. It's on your right, at corner of Mews Street (the third road). You can sometimes park down Mews.
name: Malay Street Buth Kade

description: Ammi's Meaty Delights is a home cook that delivers Sri Lankan style meat dishes. We tried their beef, chicken and pork dishes and they all turned out be very satisfying.
name: Ammi's Meaty Delights

description: Latheruma does a really tasty and cheap rice and curry lunch.
address: De Fonseka Road, near Vajira Junction
directions: This is near Visakha College, so no chance of parking nearby.  If you're coming from Duplication Rd, you can go up Vajira and turn onto De Fonseka. You can also get on De Fonseka from Dickman's Rd.
name: Lantheruma (The Lantern)

description: Hash Deli is an awesome homebaker of cakes that has shot to popularity through Good Market. They make a killer cheesecake.
address: Good Market (Diyatha Uyana), Polduwa Road, Ethul Kotte, Battaramulla
directions: Head down the Parliament Road (continuing along Horton Place is a good place to start) through Rajagiriya and into Battaramulla. Don't turn towards Parliament, keep going to your left and turn into Water's Edge. You'll see the Good Market, but only on Thursdays.
name: Hash Deli

description: Seafood Cove is Mt. Lavinia Hotel's seafood restaurant. It has a great location on their private beach front, fast service and reasonably priced, fresh seafood.
address: No 100, Hotel Road, Mount Lavinia, Sri Lanka.
directions: Coming down Galle Road, turn to Hotel Road (the road that leads down from ODEL), Mount Lavinia hotel is at the very end. Pretty hard to miss.
name: Seafood Cove (Mt. Lavinia Hotel)

description: Miss Whisk is another Colombo home baker,  and she does interesting themed cupcakes and some delicious strawberry tarts.
directions: This is the home-baker's house so we can't post the exact address - call for directions.
name: Miss Whisk

description: If you make it to the north side, Flag And Whistle is a well-appointed space with a view of the port. They do hearty but expensive German fare.
address: 5th Floor, Setmil Maritime Centre, 256, Srimath Ramanathan Mawatha, Colombo 15
directions: Pass through Port and head towards Pettah. Instead of taking Main Street, take the road hugging the coastline past St. Anthony's Church into Kotahena. It's about two block further, as the road curves. Look for the Setmil sign.
name: Flag And Whistle

description: The Ocean is the Kingsbury's seafood restaurant. The food is fresh off the ice onto the pan - it's good, and they also do a decent, affordable sashimi.
directions: The Kingsbury is right at the end of Galle Face before you turn towards Pettah. Once you walk into the lobby, walk straight in past the cafe and the Harbour Court and you'll find the Ocean at the end, on your left.
name: The Ocean (The Kingsbury)

description: Diwan is a new multi-cuisine restaurant on Sri Saranankara Road. It's mostly known for it's Indian cuisine, which is what we tried, but they also offer Chinese and Italian.
directions: Diwan is on Sri Saranankara Rd, just a bit past the Sumanadisi Bakers outlet.
name: Diwan Restaurant

description: The Vu is the rooftop restaurant at The Beach in Negombo. It may be a new venture, but the food is good, the service is excellent and as you'd expect, the view is spectacular.
directions: The Vu is located on the rooftop of The Beach (hotel). it's on Lewis Place (Beach Road),  past Camelot Beach, Paradise Beach, just after Hotel Silver Sands. It's on a lane right next to a church.
name: The Vu

description: Sugar Rush is another home-baker who makes some very nice fudgey brownies, and a great creamy lemon cake.
directions: Heading down Park Road from Havelock Road, you have to pass Cargills and Jack Tree - and just after Shalika Grounds, it's the black gate on your left.
name: Sugar Rush

description: Little Star is a not-so-little bakery in Mount Lavinia with a reputation for their Sri Lankan sweets
directions: Little Star is on Galle Rd, right next to the Cargills Food City in Mount Lavinia
name: Little Star

description: EatRight.lk is a delivery site with an exclusively healthy menu, from healthy wraps to healthy kottu. It's also got a lot of info on it to help you stay fit.
name: Eat Right

description: Zephyr is a very exciting new restaurant and bar on the Mirissa beach stretch. The food is good, and they've got a great ambience that sticks out from the rest.
directions: It's on the stretch that's directly parallel to Udupila Road/ Udupila junction, near Mirissa Beach Wadiya guest house and Ocean Moon guest house.
name: Zephyr Restaurant & Bar

description: Dilmi Roti Shop is one of the many roti shops in Mirissa. They serve chocolate rotis, pineapple rotis, cheese rotis and so on, and their milkshakes are awesome.
directions: It's near the Udupila junction and the Ocean Moon guest house, next to a wall sprayed with blue graffiti.
name: Dilmi Roti Shop (Beach Corner)

description: The Fab Cafe, the coffee lounge by The Fab is relatively unknown cafe down Castle street. They've got a chic space and some great Hot chocolate.
directions: Vivace is  on the first floor of The Fab in Borella, which is on Castle Street past  the Castle maternity Hospital, right at the turn off to Sarasavi Lane.
name: The Fab Cafe

description: Garton's Ark is a floating (boat) restaurant in the Nugegoda Wetlands Park.
address: Urban Wetland Park, 100 Nawala Rd, Nugegoda
directions: The Wetland Park is off the Nawala Rd, on the Nugegoda side. If you're coming thru Nawala, it's past the Open University and all the tile shops. If you're coming from Nugegoda, it's about 200m past the Supermarket Junction.
name: Garton's Ark

description: This is one of the better beach-side Mirissa restaurants if you want seafood. They also do a super banana & chocolate milkshake.
directions: It's near the Udupila junction, and easy to find when you get to the Mirissa beach stretch - it's near Ocean Moon guest house and Mirissa Beach Wadiya guest house.
name: Mirissa Eye Beach Restaurant

description: Curry  Leaves is one of Colombo's oldest Indian restaurants, but remains mostly under the radar. Their strength lies in their biryani, but the rest of the dishes were pretty ordinary.
directions: Curry Leaves is located midway through W.A Silva Mawatha, just past  Almaas (or before if you enter from Havelock Rd)
name: Curry Leaves

description: Pizza Hut's stuff isn't half bad, and their desserts are actually quite great, but the portions don't justify the prices.
directions: Coming down Galle Road, Pizza Hut is a bit past the St.Mary's Church, about 300m before the Dehiwala Junction.
name: Pizza Hut

description: Zen is Zylan boutique hotel's hidden gem of a Japanese restaurant. They made a great first impression on our visit, and we love their new bento boxes.
directions: Go straight on Kynsey Road past Gonuts with Donuts and Cioconut Lounge. ZEN is at the Zylan Luxury Villa, just as you turn into Rosmead Place.
name: Zen (Zylan Boutique Hotel)

description: Quick Thai serves up pretty good, filling Thai dishes at affordable prices.
directions: It's down Maitland Place past Perera & Sons and just opposite the Colombo Cricket Club Ground.
name: Quick Thai (Colombo 7)

description: Colombo's only drive-through bakery. They've got good ice cream and amazing chocolate fudge cake.
directions: Turn into Polduwa Road around Diyatha Uyana, and head left into the Waters Edge drive way. The Bakery drive-through is just a little ways in, on your right.
name: The Bakery at the Edge (Waters Edge)

description: Yumi Cake is a cute little restaurant that serves awesome desserts - chocolate fudge lovers, this is your haven.
directions: Yumi is at the end of Flower Road, on the same building as Choco Luv. It's near House of Wines.
name: Yumi Cake

description: Peace Villa is a little restaurant down Lewis Place, Negombo. The food was actually kind of underwhelming, but they serve a great glass of 'All Milkshake'.
directions: Head down Lewis Place where the hotels are - it's opposite Angel Inn, near Peacock Pub
name: Peace Villa Restaurant

description: If you're looking for a clean, charming and authentic meal in Jaffna, we highly recommend the vegetarian Malayalan Cafe.
directions: The main road in Jaffna is Hospital Road. Power House Rd runs parallel to that. If you're heading up Hospital Rd, turn right after the bust stand. Then you'll be on Power House and it's there.
name: Malayan Cafe (Jaffna)

description: The Travelling Food Tuk is a lunch-delivery place - the food is home-made, gourmet even, and the prices not too bad.
directions: Delivery is free in Kotte, Rajagiriya, Borella and Colombo 7, and otherwise the charges are for about Rs. 100-150. No delivery to Nugegoda, Wellawatte or beyond Dematagoda
name: The Travelling Food Tuk

description: Tom Yum specializes in Thai street food. We think it's some of the best Thai around.
directions: Coming down Galle Rd past 7 Stories, Tom Yum is right Opposite St.Peter's College.
name: Tom Yum

description: Mithuro Cafe does good rice and curry for cheap, and we especially love their 'chicken pieces' rotti.
address: 9, R. A De Mel Mawatha, Colombo 04
directions: It's right opposite Levi's and near Laugfs on Duplication Road.
name: Mithuro Cafe

description: Foodie-Colombo is a home baker that's good at creamy chocolate frosting cupcakes, and cake popsicles.
name: Foodie-Colombo (Home Baker)

description: The Hammock Cafe in the Galle Dutch Hospital has a great location and cool seating, but the food is pretty expensive and mediocre.
address: Old Dutch Hospital, Galle Fort, Galle
directions: At the first roundabout inside the fort, turn left, pass the Dutch Church and turn left on Queens St. Keep going till that road curves past the Magistrate's Square and turns into Hospital Street. Park there and walk forward to the Old Dutch Hospital.
name: Hammock Cafe & Pub (Galle Dutch Hospital)

description: Cremalato is a local gelato manufacturer that actually delivers frozen confections.  We tried a bunch of their new flavours and we think they're pretty awesome.
directions: The pick-up location for Cremalato is at A & M Cupcakes on Galle Road, past the Bambalapitiya Junction, opposite Barefoot.
name: Cremalato

description: Good Market isn't just once a week anymore. Besides at Diyatha Uyana (Thursdays) and Racecourse (Saturdays), you can now get Good Market's fresh, organic food straight from local vendors, on Lakpahana premises.
directions: The shop is on your immediate left inside Lakpahana grounds - Lakpahana is just opposite the Racecourse building, which is between the CCC Ground and the University of Colombo.
name: Good Market Shop (Lakpahana Grounds)

description: Arthur's pizza is now a pub, too. They do their own take on localised pizza.
directions: Coming down Galle Rd, past the Mt.Lavinia Cemetery, Arthur's Pizza is right next to the Lion Pub (oppsite Family Super).
name: Arthur's Pizza

description: Rather greasy and heavy food.
directions: It's just above Havelock Road on Isipathana Mw.
name: Deen's Kitchen

description: Huasui is yet another Chinese restaurant to join the many we've got in Colombo. The ambience is pretty pleasant and the food is nothing amazing compared to the flavour and portions in other Chinese restaurants, but it is good.
directions: Turn right at the Kollupitiya junction, and it's on your left just before the yellow Kollupitiya Super Market building.
name: Huasui Chinese Restaurant

description: Three years after opening Asylum has upped its food and service game
name: Asylum

description: Off The Hook is a fresh seafood restaurant and bar  located on Park Road run by the same management as The Bavarian German Restaurant.
directions: Off The Hook is on Park Road at the top of Esther Place, which you've likely never heard of. If you're coming up from Havelock Road it's after Fife Road and before the Cargills. If you're coming from Baseline Road, it's after the Cargills and Jack Tree.
name: Off The Hook

description: Tea Avenue is a very cosy stop on Barnes Place to have a good cup of flavoured tea and some bready goods. The prices are good and the ambience is suited for all kinds of meetups.
directions: Turn into Barnes Place from C.W.W.Kannangara Mw, go past Museus College. Tea Avenue is right at the Wijerama Mw junction.
name: Tea Avenue

description: Kebabish is a new street side restaurant in Dehiwala that offers South Asian and Mediterranean cuisine. They maybe a small place but their big on taste.
directions: On Galle Road past Chariot, right at the entrance to Hilda Lane (opposite Holy Family Convent Dehiwala).
name: Kebabish

description: The New Saraswati Cafe in Pettah is a popular little restaurant that serves good (and plenty of) vegetarian South Indian food, for cheap saivar kades prices.
directions: Go down Bodhiraja Mawatha from the main road, and when you reach the Main Street roundabout at the end, turn into Sea Street. Keep going a few hundred meters past all the jewellery shops till you see the kovil on your left, the restaurant is directly opposite it.
name: New Saraswati Cafe

description: Quick Thai serves up a range of affordable Thai dishes that are low on refinement, yet big on taste, from its modest, but elegant Pelawatta premises.
directions: Turn into Pannipitiya Road from Parliament Road and it's only about 200 meters away, on your right, past HSBC Bank and opposite Isurupaya.
name: Quick Thai (Battaramulla)

description: Navayuga is a pretty nice Indian restauran. Set inside what seems to have once been a charming house, it's cosy, and their menu is pretty wide.
directions: Abdul Caffoor Mawatha is just past HNB and Baskin Robbins on Galle Road, the restaurant is a 5-minute walk in.
name: Navayuga

description: Garden Cafe is an awesome little tea lounge hiding behind a Noritake store in Duplication Road. They serve neat tall glasses of chilled tea, not to mention smoothies and brownies, and the prices are low.
address: 399, R. A. De Mel Mawatha, Colombo 3
directions: It's where Bagatalle Road and Duplication Road cross, right opposite Envoy Mission, before British Council.
name: Garden Cafe (T-sips)

description: Chinese Juchunyuan in Colpetty is one of the few places in town to try out Chinese hotpot. The catch, however, is that if you don't add the right ingredients to the hotpot you'll basically end up drinking broth. On the flipside, it can also be excellent should you make it right.
address: 450/B, Charles Drive, off Duplication Road, Colombo 3
directions: You go down Duplication Road past Mahanama and the Beverley Street store and in front of a big white Jewellery store, you'll find the restaurant in Charles Drive on your right.
name: Chinese Juchunyuan

description: Dilmah t-Lounge at the Arcade is pretty similar to their outlet in Chatham Street. The food is good, and the space is less crowded but the service isn't great.
address: Shop No. 4, Arcade Independence Square, Colombo 7
directions: The Arcade is before you get to BMICH, after the SLBC building, on your left. Once you walk in, head left for that space with the underground fish-tank - the lounge is in the building right in front of it.
name: Dilmah t-Lounge (Arcade)

description: The new Kaema Sutra, moved from its previous premises in Arcade Independence to the plush Shangri La, still serves decent-ish food at high prices
directions: Take the lift upto the 4th floor of the Shangri La Hotel, pass through the manicured lawn and you're there.
name: Kaema Sutra

description: From what we experienced, the Baskin Robbins on Galle Road is run-down and not a good value for money. They managed to disappoint us in pretty much every department, while charging us Rs. 1400 for a three scoop sundae and milkshake.
directions: On Galle Rd, past Mercury Institute of Management and the Colpetty Pharmacy at the top of 16th Lane.
name: Baskin Robbins (Galle Road)

description: Kandy Muslim Hotel is not a hotel, but it's a very popular stop for biriyani, kottu and the likes, down the main street at Kandy's center. It's a much bigger, cleaner version of a Colombo kottu kade, and the food is actually pretty good and doesn't cost a lot.
directions: It's almost the first building on Sri Dalada Veediya just after the Clocktower roundabout.
name: Kandy Muslim Hotel

description: Jack Tree's food is pretty tasty, if you eat here you're probably going to eat till it hurts a little to walk. It is however, pricey. Is it authentic Thai? We didn't think so, you get food here that the Sri Lankan palate is quite used to.
directions: Park Road is past the Police Park, the turn is almost right after the BRC Ground. Drive in till you see the Cargills Food City supermarket on your left, it's right opposite it.
name: Jack Tree

description: Rasa Malaysia is a relatively new restaurant down the Mount Lavinia beach stretch, alongside common beach food names like Steam Boat and Loon Tao. The ambience by the beach is obviously awesome, and the food is alright - but we fell in love with their hot butter cuttlefish.
address: Mount Lavinia beach, Off De Saram Road, Mount Lavinia
directions: From Galle Road, go down the road opposite Family Super Market (the one next to Odel), turn right, into Off De Saram Road till you reach the beach. It'll be a short walk towards your left.
name: Rasa Malaysia

description: Skrumptious has introduced a new flavour to their lineup of brownies. We tried it, and it's pretty darn great.
directions: It's on Jawatte Road, right opposite the Sulaiman Terrace turn-off.
name: Skrumptious

description: Over a year since first opening its doors Tsukiji Uoichi is still going strong. They've got one of the most impressive Japanese menus in Colombo and they're execution is excellent. Their prices are on the higher end but the food is well worth it and the service is as efficient as it gets.
address: Arcade Independence Square, Clock Tower 1st Floor, Independence Square, Colombo 7
name: Tsukiji  Uoichi

description: Ginger's a small Bistro that offers a mix of Asian Flavours. They've got a cozy space with some nice curry dishes, but are also quite pricey.
directions: Head up Dharmapala Mawatha, past the Ministry of Buddha Sasana, Ginger is at the Cotton Collection premises (Opposite the park)
name: Ginger

description: Peach Valley is an old favourite when it comes to Sri Lankanized Chinese in Colombo. While the food itself hasn't changed much the recent renovations have done a great deal to help the look and feel of the place.
directions: On Flower Road, about 100m past Commons Coffeehouse, Opposite Zaizi Asia.
name: Peach Valley

description: The new Mama's remains a good spot for a beer or lime soda, but for rice and curry it's below average.
directions: This Mama's is near the mosque and lighthouse. Entering Fort, you'll get directed down Church Street. Follow that to the end and we recommend parking by the Ramparts. Then walk up the next h to your left (towards the lighthouse). That's Leyn Baan. Mama's is just 20 meters up, before the Fish Spa.
name: Mamas Galle Fort Roof Cafe (Galle)

description: Dushy's at the Good Market (Diyatha Uyana) is a small new stall that sells yummy organic health food. We tried out what they had, and we left stuffed, and not feeling guilty for a change!
address: Stall No.146, Good Market ,Diyatha Uyana, Battaramulla
directions: Head down the Parliament Road (continuing along Horton Place is a good place to start) through Rajagiriya and into Battaramulla. Don't turn towards Parliament, keep going to your left and turn into Water's Edge. You'll see the Good Market, but only on Thursdays.
name: Dushy's (Good Market)

description: With straightforward, authentic Neapolitan pizzas made in a wood-fired oven and simple yet chic decor, the family-run Oro 1889 is a treat.
directions: It's the building right next to Liberty Plaza on Duplication Road. Take the lift to the second floor.
name: Oro 1889

description: Foody Goody, one of Good Market's favourites, sells totally natural, preservative/additive-free ice-cream made at home.
address: Nuga Tree Car Park, Racecourse, Colombo 7
directions: The Racecourse is near Royal College. To get there either take the Royal College Road or turn off Independence Avenue onto Reed Ave.
name: Foody Goody

description: Yet another of the Good Market's fabulous finds, the Ceylan Creperie is a superb nomadic little stall that started up few years ago. The French owner Noemi is effervescent and passionate about her product. Follow her on Facebook or Instagram to know where to find her next and to enjoy her yummy crepes.
name: Ceylan Creperie

description: The Kingsburys poolside restaurant, the Waterscape offers a pretty great view (for now) and al fresco dining. If youre looking for a decent grill or a bit of fun fondue and have a bit of cash to spare, this place is worth it.
address: The Kingsbury Hotel, Janadhipathi Mawatha, Colombo 1.
directions: It's beside the Kingsbury pool.
name: Waterscape (Kingsbury)

description: The original Rio Ice Cream parlour is old and sweet- it's persisted through decades of war and strife as an integral part of the local community. It's worth a diabetic shock or two to experience that.
directions: It's right behind the Nallur Temple's main entrance.
name: Rio Ice Cream (Jaffna)

description: One of Marine Drive's newer additions, Genghis is a Mongolian BBQ and Grill run by Don Stanleys caterers. It shares a premises and menu with the Fat Crab, and has a lovely view of the Indian Ocean and the coastal railroad.
directions: It's on Marine Drive, near Majestic City.
name: Genghis

description: The Achcharu Kade is a popular stall that sells good quality, relatively upscale achcharu.
directions: Get to the Racecourse car park.
name: Achcharu Kade

description: Mirissa food options are somewhat lacking. If you're craving a solid rice and curry, this is the place.
directions: Heading down the Galle Road (towards Matara), pass the beach access road, the Sri Lanka Coast Guard and I&I restaurant. It's on your left. If you pass Palm Villa you've gone too far.
name: Samagi Cream House And Food Corner

description: Kingfisher remains a culinary hotspot in Unawatuna, though it's not the hidden gem it used to be. It's now an extremely popular beachside restaurant serving up reliably good fare.
directions: From the main (Galle-Matara) road pass the tea-pot and SLT signs and turn right down the Beach Access Road (Dewale). Continue past Happy Banana to where the road forks and go left. Kingfisher is down there, past Hot Rocks. If you go past there's a small parking lot.
name: Kingfisher (Unawatuna)

description: A first class fine dining experience. Perfect for when you want to pull out all the stops and celebrate. Primarily a steakhouse.
directions: The Cinnamon Grand is on the Galle Road between Galle Face Green and Kollupitiya Junction. To get to the restaurant from inside either ask or go left from the entry, through the second atrium, and to your right and down the stairs. Downstairs, it's on your left.
name: London Grill  (Cinnamon Grand)

description: Talpe Beach Resort serves tasty, intelligent food in a beautiful location on the beach. We're calling this beach fine dining cause the food has high attention to detail and you can wear a swimsuit.
directions: Head down the Matara Road from Galle past Wijaya Beach, past Frangipani Tree, past Paragon Hotel. 500m ahead on you're right you'll see the Talpe Beach Resort
name: Talpe Beach Restaurant

description: The Fat Crab on Marine Drive is well known for their seafood.
directions: Heading from Kollupitiya, go south on Marine Drive. You'll pass the Bamba rail station and Majestic City (Station Road). It's the fourth street after that.
name: The Fat Crab

description: With high quality ingredients, Santore serves authentic Italian cuisine at a great location.
directions: Santore is located right inside the Sri Lanka Tennis Association, behind the Lifestyles Gym. On the main road it's between the Green Path roundabout and the National Museum. There's some big trees and a parking lot. Walk basically in to Lifestyles and continue down the path till it ends at the tennis courts. Santore is on your right.
name: Santore Bistro Italiano

description: Just across the Kallady Bridge in Batticaloa, the Riviera serves up a good rice and curry, as well as crab and other local specialities.
address: New Dutch Bar Road, Kallady, Batticaloa
directions: Cross the Kallady Bridge, take the first left and then follow the signs. It's in Batticaloa so you obviously need to get there first.
name: Riviera Resort (Batticaloa)

description: At the Good Market, the Sovereign German Restaurant sells a range of loaves (sourdough, nutty, fiery mediterranean, etc). We don't really need to list them as you can try them all there. We've tried the sourdough and the mediterranean and they're quite good.
directions: Head down the Parliament Road and you'll see the Good Market on your left, just turn into Water's Edge. There's parking.
name: Bread Company By Sovereign German Restaurant

description: It's always Friday in here.
directions: It's next to Dutch Hospital and across from the World Trade Center. Continue on Galle Road till it basically ends and head towards the largest buildings. You can also access from York Street via Slave Island. There's a parking lot round back.
name: TGI Friday's

description: f you want real pork products, Fat Guy BBQ does them. As long as you don't mind the smoky taste that comes with, well, smoking meat, it's a tasty and authentic choice.
directions: Fat Guy BBQ offers pick-up for stuff like bacon etc at Barefoot Pub Quiz on Wednesdays (unofficially) and does delivery to metro Colombo otherwise.
name: Fat Guy BBQ

description: If you want to get away from the more crowded Nilaveli Beach Resort and have a decent, affordable meal, Pigeon Island Beach Resort is a good spot. It had a great owner (RIP) and continues to have good, hospitable staff.
directions: Take the road north out of Trinco town to Nilaveli. After the sign for Nilaveli Beach Resort you should see the Pigeon Island sign, it's around the 11th milepost. Turn right and then turn left as you get near the beach.
name: Pigeon Island Beach Resort

description: Spice Coast has good Indian food on Marine Drive. We personally think this is an ideal place for Indian takeaway/delivery and not a bad place to dine in.
directions: Spice Coast is between Holy Family Convent and Majestic City on Marine Drive (closer to Holy Family). The nearest junction is Shrubbery Gardens.
name: Spice Coast

description: Bijou is a Swiss restaurant in Negombo located along Sea Street. They serve well priced, filling meals that are accompanied by excellent service and hospitality from both the staff and owners
directions: Head down Sea Street.
name: Bijou

description: It's not cheap or fashionable but Domino's is good for an occasional guilty pizza.
directions: Head towards Nugegoda on the High Level Road. At the fly-over take the left fork, it's next to Fashion Bug. Alternately, just call and order.
name: Domino's (Nugegoda)

description: Long Feng has good service, but the food just doesn't push it far enough. It's fairly average Chinese, and within this hotel it should be more.
directions: From Slave Island, take Malay Street past the roundabout to the Cinnamon Lakeside on your right. They have valet or parking below. Long Feng is through the lobby, to the left and out back, just before the pool.
name: Long Feng (Cinnamon Lakeside)

description: If you're having people over and don't want to cook or just having a family meal, we highly recommend Pot Biriyani for takeaway or delivery. It's run by a friendly family and they make tasty, well presented and generous biriyani, among other things.
address: 29, Kadawatha Road, Off Anderson Road, Kalubowila
directions: From Hospital Road (near the Kalubowila Teaching Hospital) turn down Anderson Rd, then right onto Kadawatha Rd. It's about 200m down.
name: Pot Biriyani

description: There are a lot of places trying to compete in the Dinemore mid-range medium-fast food space, and none of them are especially good. Add Eden Cafe to the list.
directions: From Galle Road, Milagiriya is on the sea side just past Dickman's Road (heading north). From Marine Drive (heading south) it's just past Holy Family Convent. It's on the same road as Chinese Dragon.
name: Eden Cafe

description: Kami Maki is a Japanese fusion restaurant in Bamabalapitiya. While it's not the most authentic Japanese in town, they do offer some interesting fusion dishes.
directions: Kami Maki has moved to Bamba, on Duplication Road you pass AOD and Lauries Road. De Vos is on your right, past Daisy Villa Ave and before Vajira Road.
name: Kami Maki

description: There is a Chariot in the World Trade Center and it serves sushi.
address: East Tower, L4, World Trade Center, Colombo 1
directions: The World Trade Center is the biggest building in Colombo, at the end of Galle Face Green, just look for it. Inside, Chariot is one escalator ride above the information desk in the lobby.
name: The Chariot (World Trade Center)

description: Red Fort Restaurant is a small North Indian Restaurant on a small side road just off Baseline Road. The restaurant looks like an old abandoned house with wild grass and a kids playground at the front. The place is quite small but the service here is good and all in all, its a quaint, comfy place to have a meal.
directions: From Baseline Road head towards Colombo, just after the Military Police, turn left on Victoria Place.
name: Red Fort Restaurant

description: EatRite, a part of Susiko Bakers, is working to promote (healthier) rice flour products - which includes local delicacies like milk toffees and kawung.
directions: Next to International Water Management Institute (turn right at pelawatte junction)
name: Eatrite

description: Just opposite the Diyawanna Jogging Track car park is the newly built army kotthu shop. This is the closest place for joggers to come and have a bite after a light workout. They do a chicken and egg kotthu, and that pretty much sums up the whole menu. They do however have a convenient little shop which sells biscuits, soft drinks and even cigarettes.
directions: It is at the intersection between Japan Friendship road and Thalawathugoda road (on your left you'll see a lit up Kandos balloon).
name: Rakna Lanka (Diyawanna Kotthu Hut)

description: Mama Aida's is good home cooked Middle Eastern food, but also rather expensive, and only really makes sense for groups of more than six.
directions: Passing Kanatte Cemetery, head down towards the Parliament Road. Turn right at the big junction and head down Ven. Pelpola Road (Model Farm), which lead to the golf club. As you get to the golf club gates, turn left and it's about two houses down.
name: Mama Aida's Catering

description: Dilmah's charming tea lounge in the shadow of Dutch Hospital is still going strong, with a range of hot and cold teas and little and large bites.
directions: You can walk through Dutch Hospital, out past Taphouse and down the street. From the road, go down York Street past the World Trade Center turn. It's the second road on the left.
name: Dilmah t-Lounge

description: Compared to newer entrants Delifrance is overpriced and underwhelming, but they still do reliably tasty sandwiches and baked goods.
directions: It's at ODEL, which is at the corner of the Eye Hospital junction and Ward Place, near the Town Hall.
name: Delifrance (ODEL)

description: Loon Tao, roughly meaning Way of the Dragon has lost its claim as a top contender in the Chinese restaurant racket.
name: Loon Tao

description: Worth a visit for the location alone, but the menu is uninspiring.
name: Tea Breeze

description: A great place to grab some good rice and curry, along with a killer pork curry.
directions: From Thimbirigasaya go either past Fife Road (heading east/out) or past Torrington (heading west). Kirula Road is the next big road. Himsara is near the corner.
name: Himsara Foods

description: Raja Bojun is generally known for good Sri Lankan cuisine. They've moved from their old spot near Galle Face to a new location at the top of Liberty Arcade. The food is still good, so is the spread, though nothing amazing. We loved the seafood best.
address: Liberty Arcade, 282, R. A. De Mel Mawatha, Colombo 03
directions: Turn towards Premasiri Super Market from the Liberty roundabout - you'll find the Liberty Arcade on your right and the Raja Bojun neon sign on the top is hard to miss. Go in and take the lift to the 4th floor.
name: Raja Bojun

description: The Devon Bakeaway is on your left hand side just before the Nugegoda Fly Over (Past Mc Donalds). The location is ideal, although finding a parking spot can be extremely difficult in this part of town. They mainly do short eats and cakes but their lunchtime menu of biriyani, fried rice and the essential rice and curry bring in a handful of loyal customers.
name: Devon Bakeaway (Nugegoda)

description: Sovereign German Restaurant is pretty good. They serve extremely hearty German fare in a kitschy but welcoming location in Nugegoda.
directions: From Nugegoda, head down the Nawala Road past the Wetland Park, past Sampath Bank, past Saman Road. It's just before the HSBC. There's an orange sign. From Nawala head over the Kirillapone Canal bridge, past the HSBC bridge, then you're there.
name: Sovereign German Restaurant

description: With promos all week, you can get a good deal on biriyani and nasi goreng.
name: Spice & Ice (Omega Regency Hotel)

description: The Lion Pub has the best entrance of any bar in Colombo and really cheap beer and good food in large portions
directions: From Colombo, head down the Galle Road till you get to Mount Lavinia (passing No Limit, the cemetery). It's right at the Hotel Road turn off, opposite the Family Super Market.
name: Lion Pub

description: Right next to Cool Planet (Pelawatte) is a tiny little bakery serving up short eats, fresh fruit juice and a decent rice and curry. The range of available short eats may be small but the small establishment is well air conditioned, which makes it a good place to escape from the scorching heat of your average Sri Lankan afternoon.
name: The Bakery

description: It was my first time stepping into Juiceez in Battaramulla, or any of their branches for that matter. I was expecting nothing more than just a cash counter and a little stall serving juice - like they have at roots, but Juiceez is a lot more than just a juice shop. Theyve got fresh fruits, vegetables, jams, special types of rice, even plant seeds and specialized indoor plants are on display.
name: Juiceez (Battaramulla)

description: Sri Vihar (formerly known as Shanthi Vihar) is a well-known vegetarian Indian restaurant located at the Thummulla Junction. Veering towards the south Indian side of things, they offer the standard selection of dosas, thalis and idlis as well as some north Indian dishes.
directions: Walking towards the Thummulla Junction from Baudhdhaloka Mawatha, just turn towards Havelock Road and you're there. If youre driving, just pass the restaurant to find their dedicated car park on the same side.
name: Sri Vihar

description: Sunlight Garden is not one of the most popular Chinese restaurants in Colombo, but we don't really understand why. They've got good food, huge portions and great value for money.
directions: Turn right off the Galle Road after St Anthony's Mawatha - Before Renuka Hotel
name: Sunlight Garden

description: Palmyrah has long been one of the best places in the city for Sri Lankan food. They've expanded well into Western and Indian too, the food is great, and it's also a comfy, quiet, chilled space to dine at.
directions: Right on the Galle Road in Kollupitiya, on the corner of Sellamuttu Avenue, almost opposite Burger King. Once you walk into the Hotel, go straight in and take the staircase to the basement.
name: Palmyrah (Hotel Renuka)

directions: It's delivery, so call. They're based in Nawala.
name: Metabolix

description: Casadi is a beachfront outdoor restaurant located alongside Buba, serving excellent, affordable food - but sadly no booze
address: 42/18 Vihara Road, Mount Lavinia (Off Samudrasanna Road)
directions: Head down Galle Road till you get to the Mt. Lavinia Market (there's a Bata and Food City). Then head down Station Road. Take the last left, just before the road ends. Pass Old Quarry Road and turn left on Vihara Road. Follow this road until it ends in a sandy parking lot. Then cross the railtracks and it's right next to Buba
name: Casadi

description: Colombo Fort Cafe is a Harpo's run restaurant located in the popular Dutch Hospital shopping complex, serving up delicious pizzas, pastas and burgers.
address: Dutch Hospital,  Bank of Ceylon Mawatha, Colombo 1
directions: The Dutch Hospital precinct is right opposite Bank of Ceylon, near The Kingsbury. The cafe is right in front of you as you walk in through the main entrance, next to Colombo Jewellery.
name: Colombo Fort Cafe (Dutch Hospital)

description: Bakeamazing is another one of Colombo's many, many homebakers. They sell great brownies, cookies and general sugary desserts as well as savoury bites like rolls and buns.
directions: Call for address and directions.
name: Bakeamazing

description: Colombo's fine dining Japanese restaurant Nihonbashi has recently turned their outdoor dining section into a 'Yakitori Garden' - a small, bamboo-framed nook serving skewered, charcoal-grilled entrails out in the open and straight off the coals
name: Yakitori Garden (Nihonbashi)

description: The ultimate Colombo street sweet.
directions: They have routes and are usually around schools from 1-2 PM.
name: Bombai Muttai Man

description: Copper Chimney, the Hunupitiya branch appears to be the original in what has now become a franchise. This is an underrated lunch time only fried-rice kade.
directions: It's on the corner of Hunupitiya Road and W. A. D. Ramanayake Road.
name: Copper Chimney (Hunupitiya)

description: If youre passing through or spending some time in the second city and looking for a place to eat that isnt Devon or the Muslim Hotel- try this.
name: Flower Song

description: This place has a promising name, but the fried rice is not very good at all. Costs Rs. 150 for lunch, which includes rice, some vegetable thing, slices of pineapple and cucumber and some chicken fried within an inch of its life.
directions: Down Union Place, past Staple Street. Across from an HSBC.
name: Wok In A Box

description: Gerard Mendis Chocolatier is a fancy chocolate manufacturer on Horton Place that also offers a range of other desserts. While they charge a premium for their bite-sized chocolates, we found very little we actually enjoyed, and wished we had gone for a bar of Snickers instead. (And as for their cheesecake, dont even get us started.)
directions: Heading up Horton Place, it's past the Coffee Bean and on your right just before Wijerama Mawatha.
name: Gerard Mendis Chocolatier

description: There arent too many places in the world where one can sit down for a 24 course meal in a supposedly high-end restaurant for $20. This is, de facto, a fun experience and the knowledge that your wallet will emerge relatively unscathed provides a constant sop to the disappointment the taste buds feel as each course emerges.
address: Cinnamon Grand, Shri Uttarananda Road, Colombo 3
directions: The hotel is on the land side of the Galle Road, between Colpetty and Galle Face junctions. To get the the restaurant, walk outside and downstairs past the Coffee Stop.
name: Tao (Cinnamon Grand)

description: Its an unending quest for ever gooier centers and choclatier chocolate with the objective of staying ahead of the cutthroat competition.
name: Moreish

description: Not just the city's best Japanese restaurant, but one of the city's most seminal eateries, full stop.
name: Nihonbashi Honten

directions: If driving, you have to go down Maitland Place, either from Bauddhaloka Mawatha or looping around Independence Square. That's the one-way system. Then you can turn left onto Maitland Crescent. If you're cabbing it you can get off at the Independence Avenue/Stafford School junction and walk.
name: The Sugar Burger Cart

description: JU Caterers is an awesome rice & curry place - they combine tasteful ambience with bath kade prices.
directions: JU has moved a few times, now it's off Thimbirigasaya Road.  Coming up from Havelock Road, you pass Asokaramaya Temple on your left. The next left turn is Jayaratne Mw.
name: Udumbara JU Caterers

description: Fazly's Halal Refreshment is one of Colombo's most popular streetside haunts, known for their delicious, mayo dripping, affordable fare.
directions: You'll find it right at the junction of Malay Street and Church Street, very near the Slave Island railway station.
name: Fazly's Halal Refreshment

description: Kyung Bok Kung at Hotel Juliana does a pretty authentic take on Korean cuisine. The setting might be slightly dubious, and the DIY style might not be for everyone, but order the right dishes and you'll be glad you dropped in.
address: Juliana Hotel, 316 Galle Road, Kollupitiya, Colombo 3
directions: Head north on the Galle Road, the Hotel Juliana is just before Colpetty Junction. From Duplication road you can turn down St. Anthony's to join the Galle Road. The restaurant has no street signage, just walk directly through the hotel.
name: Kyung Bok Kung

description: There isn't that much to say about the Racecourse McDonald's except that it's open and it's a McDonald's. It's the same as any other McDonald's except it's in the newly refurbished Colombo Racecourse grounds.
address: Race Course Ground, Philip Gunawadena Mawatha, Colombo 7
name: McDonald's (Colombo Racecourse)

description: This Hikkaduwa institution does decent Italian.
directions: Just head down the Narigama beach stretch, till you reach Blue Moon and International Beach hotel, it's around here on your left.
name: Spaghetti & Co

description: Paradise is a convenient vegetarian rice and curry stop next to the Sri Sambuddhatva Jayanthi Mandira. It's easy on the wallet and they've also got a juice bar.
directions: Head towards the Thunmulla junction - the Buddhist Cultural Centre is a big grey building here at the mouth of Lauries Road. The Paradise food court is on its left.
name: Paradise (Sri Lankan Vegetarian Food Court)

description: Chariot is an old Colombo standard now under new management. The changes seem to be going well. We only tried a rice and curry but the service, location and general feel of the place is good.
name: The Chariot (Dehiwala)

description: Barefoot Cafe is the best place to hang out in Colombo. It's a chilled place to meet or make friends, see art, hear music, eat good food and drink affordable beer.
directions: Go down the Galle Road, it's just past the Bambalapitiya Junction (so past Majestic City). You can walk through the Barefoot store or go down the adjoining 8th Lane to a decent sized parking lot.
name: The Barefoot Cafe

description: Rolex Hotel is a Jaffna bath kade in Wellawatte which also seems to have a branch in Jaffna.
directions: It's right after the Wellawatte Arpico.
name: Rolex Hotel

description: If you're looking for a different Christmas gift this season, why not some milk toffee from Nandi's.
name: Nandi's Milk Toffee

description: Clean, tidy and located on the side of the road with a broad car park, you can spot Damith from afar by its curling yellow logo. A welcome change from the abundance of Wonder Bakeries - really not so wonderful - Damith provides honest, tasty Sri Lankan food.
address: 36 S. D. S. Jayasinghe Mawatha (Hospital Road), Kalubowila
name: Meal Centre

description: With both selling their goods on the open market the stage is set for open confrontation. It;s the established Corleones (Il Gelato) vs  the up and coming Tattaglias (Carinos) and of course YAMU is caught in the cross fire.
name: Carino Ice Cream

description: At the point where Jambugasmulla runs into Old Kesbewa Road lies AMRO Vegetarian Cafe, a little oasis of calm amidst the noisy Nugegoda soundscape. Run by four charming aunties, AMRO serves up your basic kade style Sri Lankan food - except not in a kade.
name: Amro Vegetarian Cafe

description: It was with cautious expectations that we visited the Kohuwela Roots. But here, we're happy to say, the service is good and the juices, superb. The little glass cube jutting out of Tisara Plaza is clean and nice; the staff don't stand around gormlessly and they can serve up a swift and delicious cold strawberry juice (Rs. 220).
name: Roots (Kohuwala)

description: Greenlands is a budget South-Indian joint that wins for nostalgia.
directions: When approaching Bambalapitiya junction, look out for a board reading Chef Warm. Turn left.
name: Greenlands Hotel

description: Don's Deli is a little bakery on Marine Drive that doubles as a favourite spot for lamprais, and they also serve seafood at Fat Crab upstairs.
directions: Haig Road off Galle Road is a skip away from Majestic City - head down the road to Marine Drive and you'll find the deli on your left.
name: Don's Deli

description: Cafe Eklektik is a little courtyard canteen of sorts inside the German Cultural Center. It's good for lamprais, shorteats, fresh juices and some conversation under the trees.
directions: It's right opposite the stupa of the Sri Sambodhi Maha Viharaya. Walk right in and you'll reach the courtyard.
name: Cafe Eklektik

description: Whether you're just visiting Colombo or you live here, the Cinnamon Grand Brunch is a must visit. This lavish Sunday luncheon has long been a tradition with many Colombo families who, after church or a Sunday lie in, drive over to spend their afternoon ensconced in the Taprobane restaurant amidst cascading chocolate fountains, silver platters of oysters and glistening legs of lamb.
address: Cinnamon Grand, Shri Uttarananda Road, Colombo
name: Cinnamon Grand Brunch

description: Saraswathie Lodge is another pure-veg South Indian spot on Galle Rd in Bambalapitiya. The ambience isn't as charming as nearby Greenlands Hotel but the thosai is marginally better.
directions: Just 10m below from Vishaka road.
name: Saraswathie Lodge (Bambalapitiya)

description: This is a confused place. It's barely got anything to do with chocolate.
directions: If you're coming from past the Mango Tree junction and turning right, it's onto your right. Basically almost at the end (or beginning) or Flower Road.
name: Choco Luv

description: Fortune Boat was a wonderful find. It's a Chinese restaurant, hidden just off Independence Square near the newly refurbished Colombo Racecourse. You'd never spot it unless you happened to be walking round there.
directions: It's situated right behind Olympic House. If you park at Race Course's Nuga Tree Car park, it's a short walk near the pond. Or you can come through from near Sri Lanka Foundation Institute and park near Olympic House.
name: Fortune Boat

description: The Boardwalk is our favourite new place for a drink. It's located in a beautiful open area by the Diyawanna Lake, in Battaramulla, You drink under the stars while watching cute little ducks chase each other by the water.
name: The Boardwalk

description: Happy Banana is one of the better known joints in Una, often used as both landmark and collection point - if you find yourself lost, just tell someone to meet you by Happy Banana. You'll be fine.
name: Happy Banana

description: While the location of this short eat van isn't all that, its not a bad place to stop and have a quick munch in the sunshine. It's clean, the chap that runs it friendly, and the food stands out next to many of the short-eats I've sampled in town.
name: Lauries Lane Short-Eat Van

description: Some of the food at Steamboat is good, but the delivery service and website are a bit of a shambles.
name: Steam Boat (Nawala)

description: 168 Sea Food Palace is a veteran among Chinese eateries in Colombo and is still hugely popular among locals. They do a decent take on Sri Lankan Chinese with efficient, but the place looks quite run down now.
name: 168 Sea Food Palace

description: The Coffee Bean is a pretty comfortable place to relax at, though the bill can make you rather uncomfortable.
directions: Head along Viharamahadevi park and Nelum Pokuna, and you'll find it on your right just before Barista.
name: The Coffee Bean & Tea Leaf

description: Park Street Mews Restaurant is one of those select few that have managed to remain relevant and maintain high standards throughout the years. They haven't changed much at all, but we're fine with that since the food is excellent, the service is fast and the unorthodox setting is still quite chic.
directions: From Vihara Maha Devi (along Dharmapala Mawatha) turn down Park Street. If you go all the way to the roundabout and turn left there's parking.
name: Park Street Mews Restaurant

description: Hazari's has managed to maintain their Middle-Eastern standard while moving to their new Marine Drive location.
directions: Former Redberry's location.
name: Hazari's

description: Ministry of Crab is a high-end restaurant on Dutch Hospital premises that specializes in crab cuisine - the food is just plain mouth-watering and the service is good.
directions: Take the Galle Road north until it basically ends at the Galadari roundabout, continue straight past the Kingsbury and turn right towards the World Trade Center. It's inside the Dutch Hospital, to your left.
name: Ministry Of Crab (Dutch Hospital)

description: A good drink, bites and lively conversation all tucked away in Colombo 5  this is really the club for Colombos gentlemen of class and distinction.
directions: Randoli is on Kirula Road, just a few meters passed Chitra Lane, just before the Department of Survey.
name: Randoli Sports Club

description: Sweet Wishes by Vish is a veteran among Colombo homebakers. Her bakes have survived the test of time and her new stuff and savouries taste delicious.
directions: The Sweet Wishes bakeshop is located at the top half of Moor's Road, off Galle Road in Weallawatte
name: Sweet Wishes by Vish

description: Hansa Coffee is a great place for original Hansa coffee and chocolate, and brownies. It's an affordable, cosy coffee lounge.
directions: The Fife Road turn from Thimbirigasyaya Road is next to the Jawatta Post Office. The cafe is just a little ways from Hotel Janaki and a minute away from Tasty Caterers.
name: Hansa Coffee

description: Indi and Shru have been making an effort to convince me of the merits of Mc Rice. Ive responded with stubborn scepticism.  I dont eat McDonalds (its not food snobbery, or maybe it is) but Ill eat anything from the grimmest vaddai on the train to Trinco, to the offaly offerings served behind the butchers at Malay street.
directions: It's located on Highlevel Road, a few dozen meters towards Colombo from the flyover. Pretty hard to miss with the golden arches signboard.
name: McDonald's (Nugegoda)

description: Mathura is a decent Indian vegetarian restaurant that has been around Colombo for years, but now at a new location.
directions: Located down Melbourne Avenue and opposite Siam House.
name: Mathura Restaurant

description: Rio Ice Cream, a Jaffna franchise that's about forty years old (according to Raja at its Wellawatte branch), is idyllic and affordable for ice cream lovers - they're creative with flavours and mix it up for fun with jelly and smarties, because why not?
directions: Stop near Station Road in Wellawatte, find Gaylord Tailors nearby and right opposite it is Lily Avenue - walk down and when you get to Marine Drive it's on your right.
name: Rio Ice Cream (Wellawatte)

description: Heaven's Kitchen, which apparently used to be called Hell's Kitchen, is a small but obviously successful bath kade in Rajagiriya, just past the junction down the Borella-Rajagiriya road where it snakes towards Buthgamuwa Road and the Fairmount/Fairway apartments. They have an excellent pork curry.
directions: From the Rajagiriya junction, head left past the Perera And Sons. It's down that road which leads to Medawelikada Road.
name: Heaven's Kitchen

description: The Bavarian has been around for ages, and is still hugely popular. Change can be a good thing but sometimes when you're doing something right, you should stick to it, and that's exactly what the German Restaurant has done.
directions: On Galle Road, just before the Galle Face roundabout, opposite In On The Green
name: Bavarian German Restaurant

description: A whole grilled fish, a pile of garlic drenched prawns, some ice cold bottles of lion larger, the roar of the sea all to yourself on a weekday evening. This is what Haus Chandra/the Boat Haus Cafe offers.
directions: Boat Haus Cafe is at the very end of Beach Road (turn off from Galle Rd.) just past the railway tracks.
name: Boat Haus Cafe (Haus Chandra)

description: Paan Paan is an excellent bread shop off Duplication Road. They've got superb takes on European loaves and pastries.
name: Paan Paan

description: Mythi's is a small streetside restaurant on Fife Road that offers arguably the best black pork curry in Colombo, along with a killer rice and curry.
directions: The new location is right opposite Majestic City's KFC.
name: Mythi's

description: Beach Wadiya is an old school beachside restaurant in Wellawatte. The service is fast and the food is good, but not excellent.
directions: Beach Wadiya is across from Global Towers on Marine Drive. From Galle Road you can turn down the Savoy Road. Otherwise you can head down Marine Drive towards Wellawatte, it's just across from the Kirillapone Canal.
name: The Beach Wadiya

description: Good ambience, decent food, over-rated chili paste. Okay value for groups.
directions: The corner of 5th Lane and Thurstan Road.
name: Flower Drum

description: Nana's is the premier dining venue on Colombos premier public space, the Galle Face Green. This tented kade is a favourite for kottu and BBQed seafood.
directions: Galle Face Green is towards the Fort end of Kollpity, opposite the Taj hotel. Walk down the rampart for a few minutes and you'll see Nana's tent.
name: Nana's (Galle Face)

description: Bombay Sweet Mahal is one of many shops selling Indian sweets and fruit juice in Wellawatte. What sets it apart are their special offerings, like the multi-layered fruit cocktail (Rs. 290) and the seasonal durian juice.
directions: It's on the landside of Galle Road, just past WA Silva / Station Road heading south.
name: Bombay Sweet Mahal (Wellawatte)

description: Malay Restaurant in Dehiwala is hugely popular, and after trying our their stuff we can see why. The portions: massive, the flavours: excellent and the prices: reasonable.
directions: From the Dehiwala junction (under the flyover), head up Hill Street. It's on your left about 200 meters up.
name: Malay Restaurant

description: One of the oldest Chinese restaurants in Colombo, Chinese Dragon does an okay job.
directions: Milagiriya Avenue is just north of Dickman's Road on Galle Road, as it becomes uniflow. From Marine Drive, it's just near the Bamba flats, between Melbourne and Jaya roads.
name: Chinese Dragon Cafe

description: Siam House serves up reliable and tasty Thai-fare, and they're built for volume and deliveries.
directions: Melbourne Avenue is just south of Dickman's Road on the sea side of Galle Road. From Marine Drive it's between Milagiriya Avenue and Melbourne Ave.
name: Siam House

description: Its June and rambutan-season is just kicking off  those of us who are fans can be seen flocking the pavement of Havelock Road near the BRC Grounds, asking the aiyyas to stuff plastic bags with red and green fruit.
directions: Near the Burgher Recreation Club grounds.
name: Havelock Road Fruit Market

description: One of the best views anywhere in the city or the region, in an incredibly under-rated colonial property.
directions: Head down York Street until it ends. There you are.
name: Harbour Room (Grand Oriental Hotel)

description: Dinemore's never struck me as an exceptional place. I've always enjoyed the food and found it tasty, but it's not the kind of place I'd actively choose to go to  it was more of an oh it's just round the corner or grab a quick bite sort of place.
directions: Go up Dharmapala Mawatha from Liberty Roundabout.
name: Dinemore

description: The Gallery Cafe is one of those perpetually hip spots in Colombo. The ambience is one of a kind and the  food is consistently good, but it will leave a dent in your wallet.
directions: From Duplication Road, turn right down Queen's Road, turn right on Alfred House and there you are. From Galle Road, turn up Alfred House Gardens.
name: The Gallery Cafe

description: So another day in our quest for a restaurant (not a hole in the wall/buth kadai) that serves a good rice and curry meal. We had a hot tip on The Angler a small restaurant down Hotel Road just up the road from the Mt Lavinia Hotel. We heard they served up a good homestyle curry with an emphasis on seafood, so expecting delicious piles of squid and prawn curry we rushed down to everyones favorite beachside suburb.
name: The Angler

description: La Rambla is a pleasant little restaurant tucked away down Hotel Road in Mount Lavinia. If you're looking for a quiet, private meal with good food and quick service, this is one we'd recommend. They now exclusively serve up Thai food under the same name and roof.
directions: La Rambla is located at the farther end of Hotel Rd, past St. Thomas' College a few meters before Mt.Lavinia Hotel.
name: Thai Cuisine La Rambla

description: As far as safe bets go, Bayleaf is right up there. Good Italian fare at not too exorbitant prices, and a rather extensive menu to choose from.
directions: Right opposite D.S. Senanayake College.
name: The Bayleaf

description: Harpo's is known for their premium pizzas. The delivery though was an arduous process and took way longer than we expected.
name: Harpo's Pizza

description: Tasty Caterers is one of the better bakeries in Colombo. They've got a good range of savouries, and some of the best eclairs in the city.
directions: Tasty is just a few minutes from Hotel Janaki and Hansa Cafe on Fife Road. Fife Road is very near Isipathana College.
name: Tasty Caterers

description: This place does a decentish bath packet for around Rs. 170. Samba rice, dahl, a couple of vegetables curries (gotakola, beetroot, snake-gourd, etc) and sometimes soya, wrapped up with your choice of chicken or fish
name: New Pillawoos on Kew Road

description: This is one of the more upmarket eating establishments on Vauxhall. It looks clean and professional: tiled and terrazzo floors, glass windows and an extensive, clearly printed menu on the wall. You can order from the menu but most of the food is already prepared: mounds of fried rice, plain samba rice, biriyani, nasi goreng, curries, veg.
name: Millennium Restaurant

description: Ah, Fab. It's been around longer than we can remember - since 1979 to be precise - and has consistently been keeping Colombo happy with their short eats, cakes and sweets.
directions: It's right after Amana Bank, opposite Arabian Knights and Sponge.
name: The Fab

description: The New Majestic Hotel is ironically one of the oldest hotels in Colpetty. How have they been doing since our last visit? Not bad, actually. Not good, but not bad.
directions: Right opposite MC.
name: New Majestic Hotel

description: Tiny little cafe with excellent froyo and plenty sandwiches, juices, smoothies, coffee and tea. Roast paan is on point.
directions: It's right opposite Sugar 41.
name: Avirate Cafe

description: Were not huge fans of the French macaron, but they looked so pretty that we gave Munchkin a call and ordered ourselves a box of 10, which included an assortment of vanilla, chocolate and pistachio flavours.
name: Munchkin

description: Han Gook Gwan does a authentic take on Korean cuisine at a reasonable price. You'll most likely be walking away with a new found love for Korean cuisine.
directions: On Havelock Rd, past the Police grounds and Perera & Sons, Han Gook Gwan is opposite the Adidas showroom.
name: Han Gook Gwan

description: Near the mosque on Bauddhaloka Mawatha near Bambalapitiya Junction is my contender for the bath kade that sells one of the best budget lunch packets in Colombo 4 (what the hell, maybe even the whole city!).
name: Healthy Cafe

description: On the Attidiya Road, theres a small spot that has the best vegetarian food Ive had in Sri Lanka. Perhaps the best Sri Lankan food. For Rs. 150 you get unlimited rice, kos, pollos, eggplant, potato or whatever they have on offer, plus homemade achcharu, lunuthe and papadum.
name: Dunhinda

description: Royal Thai is a great celebratory option. With delicious food and impeccable service, it's definitely one of Colombo's reigning dining royalty.
address: Cinnamon Lakeside, 115 Sir Chittampalam A. Gardiner Mawatha, Colombo 2
directions: Cinnamon Lakeside is between Lake House and the Air Force HQ. Enter the lobby and head towards the left wing to get to the restaurant.
name: Royal Thai (Cinnamon Lakeside)
