description: The Takeaway is a good alternative to the nearby Sen Saal as their short-eats are almost half the price. They're great: packed with different flavours and about as fresh as they get.
name: 'The Takeaway'

description: After an initial hiccup, Arabian Knights has bounced back well. The food is nearly back to their former glory, and coupled with the new venue, things are looking up again.
directions: It's a little past McDonalds on Galle Road, right opposite Amana Bank on your right.
name: Arabian Knights

description: When it comes to value for money, The Station is pretty difficult to beat. They tick all the right boxes with their ambience, service and food.
directions: This is basically at the very of Marine Drive which has now been extended to Dehiwala.If you're coming through Galle Rd, turn to Wasala Rd from the William Grinding Mills Junction.
name: The Station

description: Havelock Place Bungalow has got a charming little restaurant with a Barefoot-esque alfresco and good food. The prices aren't too bad, and their home-made ice cream is great.
directions: Havelock Place is the road next to the Laugfs petrol shed. The HPB is right at the end opposite Capello Salon. Walk in, turn left and walk up the wooden walkway to get to the restaurant.
name: The Havelock Place Bungalow

description: The Heladiv Tea Club does a relatively affordable range of tasty waffles, sandwiches and teas at the Dutch Hospital. You can also get a decent bottle of wine here for just Rs. 2000.
address: Dutch Hospital Shopping Precinct, Bank of Ceylon Mawatha, Colombo 1
directions: To get to the Dutch Hospital just head straight to the Kingsbury roundabout and turn right when you see the Kingsbury building. It's opposite World Trade Center. When you walk inside, Heladiv will be in front of you towards the right.
name: Heladiv Tea Club (Dutch Hospital)

description: The Galle Face Hotel is one of Colombo's oldest, best known hotels, established in 1864. Over the years it's provided food and shelter to many a revered name: Yuri Gagarin, John D. Rockefeller, Prince Phillip and Richard Nixon, to name just a few. They've changed over the years and we decided to pop in to see how they're doing.
directions: The hotel is adjacent to the Galle Face Green.
name: The Verandah (Galle Face Hotel)

description: Sits has been our favourite cake baker for a while. Her chocolate and red velvet cupcakes are some of the best in town.
directions: For pick-up, go down Baseline Road past Lanka Hospitals and past Park Road. The next junction is Vijaya Kumaratunga Mw, turn left there. Kalinga Mw is the second road on your left. Turn down that, then at the fork go to the left and park. Sits is just past the bend
name: Sits

description: I often really want to go to Roots. Because it's hot, and occasionally they give you a really good smoothie. But more often you just get a warm drink and crappy service.
name: Roots

description: Nihonbashi is one of our most famous restaurants - they serve the best sushi in the city, fact. This is the place for Japanese fine cuisine.
directions: ODEL is almost opposite the Dewatagaha mosque near Town Hall, next to Ward Place. Walk right into the main shopping space and Nihonbashi is in a nook opposite Delifrance.
name: Nihonbashi (ODEL)

description: Juiceez is pretty good. The staff are quite sweet and obliging, and their fruit is fresh and generally high quality. The menu when compared to Roots, however, is limited. They just do juices, straight up. No mixes, smoothies or health drinks.
name: Juiceez

description: Suki's Wok is one of the oldies when it comes to Chinese eateries in Colombo. Nowadays they're mostly into delivery, so we tried it, and they're okay.
name: Suki's Wok

description: Sen Saal is another one of Colombo's quick eat places. LikeFab, they serve short eats, cakes, dessert and lamprais. Sen Saal is also a good example of the Sri Lankan love of making things more difficult than they need to be - ordering and paying is a complicated, painful process here.
name: Sen Saal

description: Elite Indian Restaurant offers a wide range of savory veg and non-veg Indian dishes as well as an array of sweets.
name: Elite Indian Restaurant

description: Shanmugas is one of the older and more reputed vegetarian Indian restaurants. They're definitely pricier than most places but the food is very good and the service is excellent.
directions: Shanmugas is down Ramakrishna Road, off Galle rd, in Wellawatte. It's at the end of a small lane right before Marine Drive.
name: Shanmugas

description: The ice cream was pretty tasty. Creamy not overly synthetic- the fig flavour had the satisfying stickiness of real dried figs and while the cookies and cream didnt taste exactly like a cookie it was a good ice-creamy impersonation.
address: No.2, R.A. De Mel Mawatha, Colombo 5
name: Baskin Robbins

description: Amirthaa is a cheap, clean, pure-veg South Indian restaurant in Bambalapitiya. The place gets pretty hectic, but the food is good.
directions: Hotel Amirthaa is on Galle Road opposite the ICBT Campus, just a few metres past the Bamabalapitiya Flats.
name: Hotel Amirthaa

description: While the food at Forty Forty (a low-key lunchtime rice and curry spot tucked down a tiny alley opposite Unity Plaza on Galle Road) isn't much to write home about, the setting gives the restaurant a run-down charm.
address: Galle Road (land-side), opposite Bambalapitiya Station Road, Colombo 4
name: Forty Forty Foods

description: Sugarland is a tiny little bakery in Havelock Town, located behind The Souq.  They sell some very nice cupcakes. These don't come in many flavours - mainly just vanilla and chocolate - but they're all quite good. Simple and sweet, and with some pretty toppings.
name: Sugarland

description: I can understand the appeal of Aqua to a certain clientele. It's probably a good place for a party. The beach isn't always swimmable, but there's a nice area where you can drinks some cocktails, watch the waves or even lounge in the plunge pool without getting your hair wet. And they play some decent music. But it's certainly not worth travelling too far out of your way for in terms of food.
name: Coconut At Cantaloupe Aqua

description: Bombay Sweet Centre does an excellent almond milk (Rs. 150) and beef samosa (Rs. 30). The samosa was the best I've had in the city - full of meat and gleaming green chillis, but not stomach unsettlingly spicy. The piece of muscat was just indulgence.
name: Bombay Sweet Centre (Wellawatte)

description: We liked Sugar Bistro in the past and three years down the line that still hasn't changed. Their food is tasty, they offer a great atmosphere for dining and the service is some of the best you'll experience in Colombo.
address: 89 Galle Road, Crescat Boulevard (adjacent to the Cinnamon Grand Hotel), Kollupitiya
name: Sugar Bistro & Wine Bar

description: Cafe Japan is a small home restaurant off Marine Drive in Colpetty that does some pretty great Japanese cuisine. It's the definition of a hidden gem since the place is ridiculously hard to find. They've been around since 2000, but those who know about the place seem to want to keep it to themselves.
directions: Brace yourself. The easiest way to get here is from Marine Drive. If you're heading north, it's past Majestic City, past Hotel Sun Hill and past Schofield Place. This is where it gets confusing. It's the fourth road after Schofield Place and the second road named 10th Lane. Yeah. If you're coming the other way (south) it's four streets past Lower Bagatalle. From Galle Road, turn down Schofield Place and then turn right.
name: Cafe Japan

description: It was with some delight that I heard tales of the Crab Company - the man behind the king of 90's Colombo restaurant Don Stanelys, now delivering export quality crab to your door. Every crab junkies dream - the stuff you want delivered, by someone reliable.
address: 54 Haig Road, Colombo 4, facing Marine Drive
name: The Crab Company

description: The Yarl Eat House is perhaps Sri Lanka's best street-diner, serving spicy crab, prawns, mutton and cuttlefish along with a solid rice and curry, all for a reasonable price.
directions: Heading down Galle Road, turn right on Station Road two streets past the Savoy Cinema at the Wellawatte Junction, Taking WA Silva Mawatha, go straight. You can also access from Marine Drive. There isn't really parking down the narrow lane.
name: Yarl Eat House

description: The atmosphere of this restaurant may not be inspiring, but the seafood dishes survive the taste test.
directions: Right on Galle Road, just a short distance from the Arpico in Wellawatte. The restaurant is across the road from Arpico.
name: New Hotel Mayuri

description: Yaal Restaurant down Marine Drive still serves some very tasty and not-too-pricey food, and their crab curry is still good - though it's their biriyani that blew us away.
directions: Vaverset Place is a road just before Delmon Hospital on Galle Road, go down this road to Marine Drive and you'll find Yaal on your right.
name: Yaal Restaurant

description: The Floor By O! has been around for a while now, we've been there before and we find ourselves going back more. With very reasonable prices, competent staff and good music, they seem to know what they're doing.
directions: Coming down Maitland Crescent, on your left, adjoining the Colombo Cricket Club.
name: The Floor by O!

description: At the end of Marine drive its a little fenced off patch of land with seating out doors and a small covered structure for cooking between the train tracks and the sea. There are tables just two feet from the ocean and the food is simple but good and reasonably inexpensive. Prawn fried rice with hot butter cuttle fish and lashings of their chili paste comes to less than Rs. 1000/=.
name: R & R Beach Restaurant

description: The Island Coffee shop is so utterly charming and captures perfectly the spirit of a Colombo that is now slipping from the collective memory - an age where nothing was imported and everything had to be local.
name: The Island Coffee Shop

description: Klassy is a really good pastry shop - reliable for savouries and milk toffees.
address: 2B De Fonseka Road, Colombo, Sri Lanka
directions: At the intersection of Dickmans Road (Sir Lester James Peiris) and De Fonseka Road.
name: Klassy Pastry Shop

description: Its called the swimming club, so this ought to be a good place for a swim - and it is. Apart from splashing it out in the pool, you can also dive into their excellent club-level food.
directions: Directly opposite The Prime Minister's residence at Temple Trees and passed the Indian and American embassies.
name: The Colombo Swimming Club

description: We've had quite a few new ice cream parlors pop up over the past few years (no complaints from us!), but Il Gelato still reigns supreme when it comes to high quality ice cream. There's just this small issue of having to empty your wallet for a few scoops..
name: Il Gelato

description: The VOC is a one of the best places in the city to get lamprais, and we've heard their burgers are pretty good too.
directions: The DBU is right at the Thunmulla junction, a little ways from the DBU's big black gate.
name: VOC Cafe (Dutch Burgher Union)

description: Min Han (or Ming Han) is one of our favorite Chinese restaurants. It's cheap, super tasty and the waiter Wijapayala orders for you.
directions: On Duplication Road, past Manhattan Fish Market, turn right at the first road after Bars Cafe. Min Han is in a tiny house on the left side of the lane.
name: Min Han

description: Java Lounge in Jawatta has become our go to spot for casual meetings or we just want to grab a quick coffee. They've got an accessible location, some surprisingly good pasta dishes and coffee that hits the spot more often than not.
directions: Going up Thimbirigasaya, if you turn left on Jawatta it's just around the corner.
name: Java Lounge

description: Local biryani doesnt seem to get the attention it deserves.  If you think about it though those plates of saffron tinged rice are a central part of life for millions of Sri Lankans.
directions: This is just opposite the Maradana Railway Station off the Maradana Junction. If you're lost, ask a Tuk driver. The place is an institution.
name: Hotel De Buhari

description: To any sensible Sri Lankan the mere discovery of good fried rice should be a cause of great joy, but a shop dedicating every single drop of its oil, sweat and ajinomoto to the mixed up manna? Well, we we were excited to say the least.
address: Between Moor's Road and Boswell Place, Marine Drive, Wellawatte
name: Copper Chimney

description: Nalapaham is for those of you with a sudden mid-day craving for crab - besides the biriyani, idiyapam and kottu, they serve tasty crab, cheap.
directions: This road is almost exactly opposite Arpico, somewhat near Delmon Hospital.
name: Nalapaham

description: Hotel de Pilawoos, one of the many Hotel de Pilawoos, is probably the best Hotel de Pilwaoos in town.
name: Hotel De Pilawoos (Kollupitiya)

description: Between a Maldivian restaurant and a playground is a strip of sand that leads to a broad beach and the Indian ocean. Lani's decorated fishing boat will be on your left. The entrance is behind the boat.
name: Lani's Sea Food Restaurant

description: Pagoda Tea Rooms is basically the only place to chill out at on Chatham Street - it's in a lovely building from all the way back in 1884. They do a super lamprais, and fun fact: Duran Duran shot a music video here.
directions: When you reach the Kingsbury roundabout, turn into Janadipathi Mawatha, and turn right at the clock tower. Pagoda is after the mosque on this street.
name: Pagoda Tea Rooms

description: The chicken was excellent, but it took them half an hour so we would have been pretty enraged if it wasn't. The actual biryani though, for us this is the rich saffron and meat infused rice, was disappointing.
address: 124, S De S Jayasinghe Road, Kohuwala.
name: Big Bite Biryani

description: Occupying the former Agra bar, Shimmer, the Manchester dons the mantle of the previously Indian themed space, changing pretty much nothing except its name.
directions: Manchester is behind Agra, which is near Independence Square.  From Independence Ave, turn  down the road past the  National Library Board. Then turn left and immediately right again, down Foundation Ave.
name: The Manchester

description: Spice is a peculiar yet charming little restaurant located off the dusty, exhaust-filled Galle Road.  Screened by a painted concrete slab, a passing glance from a tuk is likely to overlook the large dining space concealed behind. The restaurant slash kade hiding beyond the colourful wall is housed under an aluminium canopy, held up by scaffolding and corrugated sheets of metal. Despite its minimal structure, however, Spice is really a rather pretty place to sit down for a meal.
name: Spice Restaurant

description: Lunu Ambula, on Thimbirigasyaya Road, is a buth kade with a rustic feel. Some are decent, others are outstanding.
address: Ven. Muruththettuwe Ananda Himi Mawatha, Colombo 5
directions: Turn into Thimbirigasyaya road and come to the junction to Jawatta Road.  Lunu Ambula is right there on the junction under the big tree. It's closer if you come from Highlevel road.
name: Lunu Ambula

description: An old favourite, Wijaya Beach continues to serve up fresh seafood, excellent pizza and a sun-dappled ocean view.
directions: Take the Pinnaduwa exit from the Southern Expressway, and drive towards Thalpe. Wijaya Beach is on Dalawella beach, opposite the railway tracks.
name: Wijaya Beach

description: The Roti Stop is a classic down south destination. While there are numerous roti joints dotting the Galle Road by almost every tree and milespost, the Unawatuna Roti Stop is one of the more iconic of our unleavened bread spots.
name: The Roti Shop

description: If you're in Colombo 7 and you're craving a good biriyani, Raheema is one of the first places that will come to mind. That's exactly the situation we found ourselves in, and we're glad we dropped in.
address: Cumaratunga Munidasa Mawatha, Colombo, Sri Lanka
directions: coming down Thurstan Rd, past the Alfred Place turn off, Raheema is right opposite  the Thurstan College pool entrance.
name: Raheema Hotel

description: Indian Chaat Corner is a tiny barely-noticeable restaurant that specializes in Indian street food. The chaat is still pretty good, and they've got a nicer interior now.
directions: Drive a little way past the Wellawatta Market and 32nd Lane is onto your left. The Chaat corner is at a residence a few metres in onto your left.
name: Indian Chaat Corner

description: Coco Veranda on Ward Place is one of Colombo's most popular coffee shops. We loved them in the past, but this time around it was a let down.
directions: Turn into Ward Place from the De Soysa Roundabout at the Town Hall Junction. Coming down Ward Place past the University Grants Commission, Coco Veranda is on the right, opposite the Kynsey Place turn off.
name: Coco Veranda

description: Milk & Honey has impressive healthy food options, and really pleasant ambience. Also some of the best brownies in the city.
directions: It's right next to the Indian Summer restaurant, opposite the Saskia Fernando Gallery. You'll see a children's store that says 'Milk' - the cafe is right inside at the end.
name: Milk & Honey Cafe

description: It must be said that somewhere on the journey from family bakers to mega-chain standards fell. The cream buns nowadays just arent the same
name: Perera & Sons

description: Crossroads, run by Tasty Caterers, is a good restaurant. With a funny menu dancing across a variety of cuisines (Thai, Western, Mexican, Italian, Sri Lankan) the food, while not authentic, lives up to the name of its proprietors and actually is quite tasty.
name: Crossroads

description: Sponge is one of the oldest bakeries in the big city, and one of the biggest. They are still going strong with a quality range of savouries and sweets, and now also lamprais and gourmet sandwiches.
directions: Sponge is towards the Kollupitiya junction side of Galle Road, opposite Aloe Avenue, Makeen Books and Fab.
name: Sponge

description: Providing the city with crispy white hoppers and tongue burning katta sambol for well over 60 years, Green Cabin is one of Colombo's older, more venerable eating establishments.
directions: Go down Galle Road past Bamba Junc. It's opposite Swarnamahal.
name: Green Cabin

description: Their special is the CBP and it's really pretty special. A rich but not heavy mousse, an intense and lasting chocolate hit, a fair lug of alcohol and biscuit perfection- not too mushy not too crunchy.
name: Decadence

description: Even without the exclusively Chinese clientele and waiting staff you'd know it was a mainland restaurant from the quality of the tofu- just softer and silkier than locally-run restaurants can achieve.
name: Lucky Star

description: Toby's Estate in Mount Lavinia is a very cosy hangout that serves okay-food that's a little on the pricey side - this international franchise is still best known in Colombo as a coffee stop rather than for its dine-in.
address: Galle Road, Dehiwala-Mount Lavinia, Sri Lanka
directions: From Colombo towards Mount Lavinia, the restaurant is on your right just past Cargills Food City, and opposite Pintaliya Road.
name: Toby's Estate

description: Sulthan Palace (formerly Rahumania) is a great spot at the Town Hall hub to get a delicious, cheap range of biriyanis, meats and even Sri Lankanized Chinese.
address: 45A, C W W Kannangara Mawatha, Colombo 7
directions: It's almost opposite the Dewatagaha Mosque.
name: Sulthan Palace

description: What is magic corn? We're not sure where the magic part comes in, but it's basically a little snack made from steamed kernels of sweetcorn mixed together with a variety of spices, salt, pepper, cheese, garlic, etc. depending on the flavour you ask for.
address: Majestic City, Galle Road, Bambalapitiya, Colombo 4
name: Magic Corn

description: Naniyori is good value for money.  Decent dine-in at Nawala and best sushi delivery in Colombo.
directions: From Nawala junction, turn onto Narahenpitiya - Nawala Road and it's to your right.
name: Naniyori

description: Best brownies ever.
name: Deepika Kodikara (Home Baker)

description: Colombo's biggest department store's upscale food court area
name: The Promenade at ODEL

description: Steam Boat provides a lovely spot for sunset and wave watching. With an elevated cement and canopy dining area as well as shaded chairs and tables on the sand, venue wise they've got it spot on. Food, however, not so much.
directions: Beach Road is just before Factory Outlet, opposite Star Dogs. Steam Boat is at the beach end of it. But they also do delivery.
name: Steam Boat (Mount Lavinia)

description: When Gonuts with Donuts started off they were all the craze. Now many years down the line, the hype has died down, their prices have gone up, but they're still pretty decent.
address: Dudley Senanayake Mawatha, Colombo 00800, Sri Lanka
directions: The drive-through branch is on Horton Place really, at the Kynsey Road junction. You can access it from Kynsey Road the easiest, heading south.
name: Gonuts With Donuts

description: In Negombo, where you have less ice creamy options (although an Il Gelato is opening up soon), Rio stands as a pleasure dome filled with cool, brightly coloured confections.
directions: Rio's is on Sea Street (where everything is). Fastest is to connect to Sea Street from the St. Mary's junction and drive a bit north.
name: Rio Ice Cream (Negombo)

description: We were recently introduced to the Sugar Shack, run by Aru De Silva. From the looks of Facebook she seems to be one of the younger players emerging on our rapidly growing network of home bakeries. Her menu isn't extensive - no french macarons, meringues or fancy desserts - but she offers a large variety of cupcakes, cakes, brownies and cheesecake.
directions: Right across the road from Coffee Bean car park.
name: The Sugar Shack

description: One of the top Kottu places in Bambalapitiya.
directions: More or less opposite Majestic City.On the corner of Galle road and Daisy Villa avenue
name: Hotel De New Pilawoos (Bambalapitiya)

description: This little buth kade on Sri Saranankkara Road in Dehiwala is a hidden gem. It doesn't really have a signboard and seats only a cramped eight people, but the family running it serves up consistently tasty rice and curry.
directions: It's between Bhathiya Mawatha and Hathbodiya Mawatha, on the east side. There's a road that leads to the Sri Anjaneyar temple on the west site, the kade is kinda opposite that.
name: Suman Hotel

description: Cafe On The 5th has been a local favourite for years, serving tasty food in a comfortable al fresco style atmosphere. Their quality has taken a nose-dive recently, though.
directions: Turn off Thurstan Road just past the Thurstan College, going past Flower Drum. From Duplication Road, it's the left turn after the Bellagio Casino.
name: Cafe On The 5th

description: Urban Kitchen is one of the city's newer dining halls. Located right next to Arpico, the lovely, large room serves a variety of cuisines from around the globe.
directions: You can access Urban Kitchen easiest from the Union Place side of Arpico. It's no longer connected directly to Arpico, you have to enter from outside.
name: Urban Kitchen

description: Chopsticks is a down to earth joint in Nawala serving a vast menu of cheerfully Sri Lankanised Chinese food. Fried rice, devilled chicken, black bean pork and so on - the Sino-Lankan side of the menu is huge, and most of what we devoured was incredibly satisfying
name: Chopsticks

description: Paradise Road Cafe is one of our favourite haunts, cocooned in a small, white, quiet space atop a lovely store full of antiques and art. The food and coffee are very good, and it's an excellent book nook.
directions: As you go up Dharmapala Mawatha towards Town Hall, pass Cotton Collection too and just after Commercial Bank you'll find the black-and-white striped banners of Paradise Road Cafe on your left.
name: Paradise Road Cafe

description: If you're around the ODEL junction (Lipton Circus), right next to the Eye Hospital there's a good petti kade. You can tell because it's busy - a sure sign of promising eats.
address: In front of Eye Hospital, Ward Place, Colombo 7
directions: It's in front of the red and yellow Eye Hospital building, opposite side of Ward Place from ODEL. Lipton Circus roundabout.
name: Ward Place Petti Kade

description: Cioconat offers some tasty, generous fare, but even so it still isnt exactly where it could be.
directions: It's at the corner of Kynsey Road and Barnes Place.
name: Cioconat Lounge (CLOSED)

description: Ensconced in a great banyan tree in the heart of Colombos entertainment district, Nuga Gama serves signature Sinhala cuisine, escapism and enchantment. To have dined there is to have glimpsed at an ancient Sri Lanka that has long-since begun to disappear into a blur of Western technicolour.
address: Cinnamon Grand, Shri Uttarananda Road, Colombo 3
directions: Go down Galle Road, turn into the Cinnamon Grand (past Colpetty Junction). In the Cinnamon, Nuga Gama is downstairs.
name: Nuga Gama (Cinnamon Grand)

description: This is the citys rising late-night kottu star.
address: Corner of St Anthony's Road and Galle Road, Colombo 3
directions: Down the Galle Road towards Fort, past the Bambalapitiya junction, past  Walukarama Road, and the original Pilawoos.  Opposite 15th lane/the Sumsung store.
name: Hotel De Plaza

description: If you're working around Slave Island or Fort, Curry Much does a decent buth packet with better packaging.
directions: From Union Place, go past the JAIC onto Braybrooke Street. From Gangarama, go down Muttiah.
name: Currymuch

description: Colombo wants for good Italian options. While theres no lack of Italian restaurants none of them quite does justice to the real gusti ditalia  Its not that Bayleaf, Il Ponte, Echo are bad exactly  just that they arent quite good enough. On occasion though Colombos wannabe trattorias can surprise you with the quality of their cooking. The other day we stepped into Echo and discovered they serve up a very respectable anti pasti buffet for Rs. 1200+.
directions: Go down Galle Road, past Kollupitiya junction, before Galle Face.
name: Echo (Cinnamon Grand)

description: 88 Chinese Seafood Restaurant is a long time player in the local Chinese food scene. It's incredibly popular among b0th locals and Chinese expats, and while it wasn't terrible, it didn't really live up to the hype.
directions: Off Havelock Road, just before the thunmulla round about.  The turn off is a little way past Xilaton, next to La Passion
name: 88 Chinese Seafood Restaurant

description: A&M cupcakes is a charming little cupcake boutique located on the Galle Road, opposite Barefoot. Cupcakes are trendy, tasty little treats - good for eating and even better for instagramming.
directions: It's right opposite Barefoot on Galle Road. The location on gmaps might have a slightly different navigation so be mindful.
name: a & m Cupcakes

description: Besides one dish, Moon River gave us nothing to be happy about. We honestly cannot recommend it with all the new alternatives in Colombo.
directions: Head down Thimbirigasyaya Road, pass Sen Saal, its on your right before the turning to Fife road.
name: Moon River

description: Elephant House Fountain Cafe is a photocopy of a once historical watering hole. John Keells bought Elephant House and shut down 'non-performing' brands like the once popular Fountain Cafe, only reopening the place recently. Now the fountain is still there but the cafe is wedged behind a supermarket, literally at the end of aisle 10.
address: Dr Colvin R de Silva Mawatha, Colombo 2
directions: On Union Place, near the Staple Street junction, there's a Keells Supermarket. Walk in and down Aisle 10, or enter from the back.
name: Fountain Cafe

description: Amrith has moved to a new location. The food is still consistent and while they aren't the best in town, they're still a valid option for Indian food.
directions: Right on the corner of Dickmans Road and Havelock Road.Opposite the Police Park.
name: Amrith

description: Buba Restaurant and Beach Club is one of Colombo's older beach hangouts. They've got pretty secluded part of Mt.Lavinia beach to themselves, seafood is decent plus its mostly BYOB ;).
directions: Pay attention. Head down Galle Road till you get to the Mt. Lavinia Market (there's a Bata and Food City). Then head down Station Road. Take the last left, just before the road ends. Pass Old Quarry Road and turn left on Vihara Road. Follow this road until it ends in a sandy parking lot. Then cross the railtracks to Buba.
name: Buba Restaurant And Beach Club

description: They do chicken biryani pretty darn good and now have crab and lamb on the menu.
directions: It's before you get to Barefoot on Galle Road, just before the St. Kilda's Lane turnoff. Big green building.
name: Banana Leaf

description: The Barnesbury is another cafe in Colombo. They've got a lovely garden out back, interesting London themed decor and they do an ordinary range of generic Western dishes.
directions: It's on Barnes Place between Wijerama and Kynsey Road junctions.
name: The Barnesbury

description: Thin crust, wood-fired pizza, with toppings like Pol Sambol. Michaelangelo is good for delivery, if you're really patient.
name: Cafe Michaelangelo

description: if youre one of those who've not ventured further into Fort than a night at Dutch-Hos, this is a good place to start.
directions: Exit from the back of the dutch hospital and walk up the lane that takes you past the Steuarts building and Avirate- you'll reach Chatham Street. Turn right its opposite Pagoda Tea Rooms.
name: Orchid Restaurant

description: Sweet Tomato Halal Family Restaurant is a decent if slightly expensive option in Pettah, across from the Red Mosque. Down 2nd Cross Street, this clean and friendly establishment serves a decent biriyani at the rather high price of Rs. 400. They also do fried rice and rice and curry.
directions: Head down Main Street into Pettah. You can then walk down (towards the Port). It's at the corner, right across from the mosque.
name: Sweet Tomato

description: Rocco's has a good dine-in restaurant in Rajagiriya serving wood-fired pizza with a wide range of toppings.
directions: From the Battaramulla Road, turn right onto Nawala Road before the Rajagiriya Children's Park.
name: Rocco's

directions: From the Panchikawatte Road, go past the Jethawana junction and turn up K. Cyril Perera Road (Bloemendhal). Pass Sugathadasa, the Port Access Road and oil storage. It on the bend near St. James Lane.
name: Baker Street

description: BreadTalk. We've been there a few times. And on every visit I'm strangely drawn to the polished, round buns, the cheesy breads, the flaky danishes - and each time, I come away disappointed - like a sad, slightly singed moth.
address: Ven Baddegama Wimalawansa Mawatha, Colombo, Sri Lanka
directions: From the ODEL roundabout (Lipton Circus) head down Dean's Road (EW Perera) about 50 meters.
name: BreadTalk (Lipton Circus)

description: This has long been among the most exciting restaurants in the city. Not because of its cutting edge cuisine but because, for years, this was the only place to eat at Katunayake (BIA) airport. So a meal at the Palm Strip meant you were going places.
directions: You have to be traveling abroad to go here. Go down the Negombo Road till you get to the Airport turnoff. Once in the Airport, go up the escalator after immigration and it's to your left.
name: Palm Strip (At The Airport)

description: Taprobane's dinner buffet is pretty awesome. For just Rs. 2200, the spread's large and the food's top quality. Highlights? Their egg hoppers and their chocolate fudge.
directions: From Galle Road, the Cinnamon Grand is between Galle Face Green and Colpetty Junction. Inside the hotel, walk through the second lobby and downstairs.
name: Taprobane (Cinnamon Grand)

description: Nestled in a deserted corner of Trincomalee Harbor, The Dutch Bank Cafe, is the first luxury restaurant to be opened since the end of the troubles.
address: 88 Inner Harbour Road, Trincomalee, Sri Lanka
name: The Dutch Bank Cafe

description: Amaravathi is a non-vegetarian South Indian restaurant located on a narrow street off the Galle road, serving great thosas, thalis and one of the country's best biriyanis.
name: Amaravathi Restaurant

description: I am obsessed with dhal-wade. Some months ago I was lucky to be served homemade wade, and my life has never been the same since. Its a well known fact that few restaurants compare to Sri Lankan home cooking, and the home cooked wade I had made all of the wade Ive bought at train stations seem like tasteless blocks of cardboard.
directions: It's next to the Shalinga Liquor Store on Post Office Road.
name: The Wade Cart (Trinco)

description: Burger's Hut in Dehiwala was the first of the Burger's King clones, but a good one at that. We dropped in again after a while and we're happy to see that their burgers are still tasty and cheap. Unlike Burger's King though, BH is open from 1 pm.
address: Allen Avenue, Dehiwala (Opposite Nawalanka Food City)
directions: From Galle Road you can turn up from the William Grinding Mill Junction, then take your first major right. It's about 300m up the road, across from a grocery store. You can also come from the Karagampitiya side, it's about 1km after the Zoo.
name: Burgers Hut

description: Jade is a Chinese restaurant in Nugegoda that offers an affordable alternative to the staples, Flower Drum or Chinese Dragon
name: Jade

description: Heladiva is a bath kade style restaurant housed in a beautiful old bungalow on Hunupitiya Lake Road serving authentic Sri Lankan cuisine.
directions: Heladiva is down the lane that runs next to the Gangaramaya Temple. From the Gangarama Road (James Peiris Mawatha) you can turn down the road which leads to Mobitel or the one that leads to Gangaramaya (Sri Jinarathna). Hunupitiya Lake Road is the next lane.
name: Heladiva

description: Namaste is a new Indian restaurant in Nugegoda serving mainly North Indian cuisine. While the staff are lovely and the place is nice, we can't really say the same about the food.
directions: On the High Level Road, go over the Nugegoda flyover and continue for 2-3 km.
name: Namaste

description: What a vibrant new place to stop at to get a bite to eat on the way out of Colombo... Cafe J - the newest eatery to hit the livening Negombo strip. Belonging to the Jetwing Group, this juice bar/patisserie/cafe is bright, clean and stylish, opening out onto the road on one side and the ocean on the other.
directions: If you drive to Negombo, turn from Porutota road and keep an eye out for the Jetwing name boards on the side of the road, leading up to the hotels. Find Jetwing Blue. Cafe J is just next door.
name: Cafe J

description: Carnival is a Sri Lankan institution, serving not great but cheap ice cream in an accessible and interesting location.
directions: From the south, head up the Galle Road past the Hotel Juliana. Carnival is on the landside, just before Colpetty junction.
name: Carnival Ice Cream Parlour

description: Indian Hut offers decent and affordable North Indian and Chinese cuisine in Galle
directions: Enter Galle Fort through the main entrance and turn left to Church Street. Go straight down the (rather narrow) road, until you end up on Rampart Street. Indian Hut will be visible to your right.
name: Indian Hut Family Restaurant

description: Mango Tree is a hugely popular Indian restaurant on Dharmapala Mawatha, serving mainly North Indian cuisine. The food is very rich, and quite good.
directions: From the Liberty Plaza roundabout, go up Dharmapala Mawatha until you see it on your right. It's at the Flower Road/Gangarama junction.
name: The Mango Tree

description: Located in Kitulgala, the Kitulgala Rest House is just over two hours by car, or about three hours by bus, from Colombo. With a touch of 'old-world charm' the rest house is the perfect place to relax in style after a day of whitewater or hiking in what's fast becoming Sri Lanka's adventure capital
directions: The rest house is about 37km along the A7 (Avissawella-Hatton-Nuwara Eliya) highway. There are several buses that run regularly from Colombo that will stop in Kitulgala. The rest house is well known by locals so don't hesitate to ask for directions if need be.
name: The Bridge Restaurant

description: California Grill is one of the city's older fine dining restaurants, located at the rooftop of the Galadari Hotel. They serve a selection of seafood, steak and grills as well as a variety of flambe dishes.
name: California Grill (Galadari)

description: Alumka Caterers have been very successful since they opened up their take out restaurant in Battaramulla several years ago. They offer a variety of food from Rice and Curry and Chinese Fried Rice Packets to Kotthu, Hoppers and even Vegetable Rotti and Wade. Nowadays, come dinner time, you will find their little hole in the wall frenzied by crowds of hungry people.
address: Pannipitiya Road, Sri Jayawardenepura Kotte, Sri Lanka
directions: Turn to Pannipitiya Road from Battaramulla Junction, it will be on your Left about 400m down.
name: Alumka Food Cabin

description: All in all it was a decent and quite satisfying meal. If you are looking for a cheap, decent place to get your lunchtime fix, we recommend making the trip.
directions: On the High Level Road, go across the Nugegoda flyover, heading out of town. Bo Sevana is a tiny spot on the right, about 20 meters past the Jambugasmulla Road junction.
name: Bo Sevana

description: Paan Paan makes great bread which turns into great sandwiches, melts. etc. It's not cheap but you're getting good, healthy value for money.
directions: From Duplication Road, turn into Queens road (Cricket Club Cafe). It's on the end of the road right on the T Junction there.
name: Paan Paan Sandwich Bar

description: A charming little sandwich bar owned by the loveliest couple with delicious food.
directions: Just opposite Bo Sevana on Jambugasmulla Road.
name: LeeSH

description: Sri Lankas favourite submarine is probably that at Dinemore. This fast food franchise has been around for quite a while, and by the looks of it theyve expanded and opened up many more restaurants in Colombo, Kandy and even expanding internationally by branching out into the beautiful islands of the Maldives.
name: Dinemore (Kohuwala)

description: Short eats in Battaramulla? Klassys is King.
directions: Opposite Wooden Art
name: Klassy (Battaramulla)

description: Adma Agro in Nuwara Eliya is well known for their fresh strawberries and strawberry products. The store itself isn't in the best shape, but thankfully their desserts are still pretty tasty.
directions: Adma Agro is located about 1 km past the Gregory Park (Lake) away from Nuwara Eliya town. It's just past the bridge on a hill to the right.
name: Adma Agro

description: Sen Saal was one of the very first large scale bakeries to establish themselves in Battaramulla. Since then they have added a restaurant at the back where they serve things like Lasgna, Rice and Curry, Nasi Goreng, Fried Rice and even the elusive Lamprais. They also do submarines and fresh fruit juices. Having lived in Battaramulla for so many years now, I was excited about writing a good review to rep the town. But oh my god, this is going to be the furthest thing from a good review!
name: Sen Saal (Battaramulla)

description: Panino makes excellent sandwiches. Filled with tasty ingredients, grilled, prepared with love. If you visit the Good Market each Thursday they're well worth a try. Otherwise they're a good choice for catering or office lunches.
name: Panino

description: The Manhattan Fish Market has delicious seafood and ridiculously friendly stuff - it's an awesome place to dine at if you can handle the bill.
directions: From the Liberty Road junction head down Duplication Road, past St. Anthony's Mawatha till Deal Place. You can turn either way to park.
name: The Manhattan Fish Market

description: Over the weekend I found myself wandering about Majestic City doing a bit of shopping. After a couple of tiresome hours of trying to find a gift, I hungrily dragged myself to the spacious, although somewhat crowded, Majestic City food court. They offer a good variety of food to choose from; theres a Pizza Hut, KFC, Magic Corn, Juice by Roots, Chinese and Mongolian food stalls, and theres even a small pastry shop in the corner. Personally though, the main feature would have to be Peppers  Pizza and Pasta.
name: Peppers (Majestic City)

description: Hotel Top Form is an Indian restaurant under the Nugegoda flyover. It's OK, the lunch packets are not especially good but we hear good things about the tandoori.
directions: Take the High Level Road out of Colombo, it's just under the flyover, on the right side. You can't turn down there but sometimes you can park under.
name: Hotel Top Form

description: Sizzle is an experience restaurant with a great selection of meats and even decent vegetarian. Everything is served sizzling, even the drinks.
directions: Head up Galle Road past McDonald's, Walukarama is the street just after 5th Lane (heading north).
name: The Sizzle

description: Plant your feet in the sand and watch the waves roll in as the traffic of Mt Lavinia Beach frolic by. Apart from this initial attraction the rest of our experience was somewhat forgettable.
directions: Go down Galle Road to Mount and turn down Hotel Road. At College Avenue turn right. Then take the next big right (De Saram Road) and continue. De Alwis is the fourth street on your left.
name: The Lavinia Breeze Mount Lavinia

description: The Vege Way is one of the latest additions to the clustered stalls of wholesome foods, beverages and knick knacks that is the Good Market.
name: The Vege Way

description: Shanghai Terrace is a Chinese Restaurant that recently opened up in Ethul Kotte. They serve up some good looking Chinese food at a reasonable price. There is a charming little terrace on the roof top (hence the name Shanghai Terrace) accompanying a slightly dodgy looking bar. The service was really good and the food - not too bad either.
address: 811, Kotte Road, Ethul Kotte, Sri Lanka.
directions: Coming towards Nugogda from Kotte Road, it is on your right.
name: Shanghai Terrace

description: KBQ in Rajagiriya does fried chicken and noodles, with a Korean twist.
directions: Head down the Parliament Road through Rajagiriya. This is right past a Perera and Sons' outlet onto your left, and a little way before Pizza Hut.
name: Korean Barbecue KBQ

description: The Diyawanna Food Court, located in Alcatraz, is a recent development with some of the big names of the fast food culinary scene. The place is essentially just a big car park and probably the best place for kids to ride their bike or try on their roller blades. These days its also become inhabited by shady looking couples whispering sweet nothings to each other.
name: Diyawanna Food Court

description: Chatz is a newly opened little cafe in Horton place. They have a crazy range of things to eat - from lamb chops and grilled prawns to mutton kotthu and buriyani (asian) to nachos and fajitas (Mexican). They also do some salads, soups, burgers and pizza; no shortage for choice really.
directions: If you pass coffee bean (on your right) and come down horton place, Chatz is on your left hand side.
name: Chatz

description: Acropol Restaurant which formerly resided on R.A De Mel Mawatha has moved to a new location on Galle Road, Colombo 03. If you're a fan of shawarmas it's worth a visit.
directions: On Galle Road, just past Swarna Mahal Jewellers (opposite to Green Cabin), on the sea side. There's a tree which tends to cover the view of the entrance, so keep an eye out.
name: Acropol

description: Maharaja Palace is one of the few fine dining Indian restaurants in Colombo. The prices are high but the portions are actually quite large now. Their food was always pretty good and it seems they've made some necessary improvements.
directions: Turn right to Rajakeeya Mawatha from Thurstan Road, Entrance is on your left.
name: Maharaja Palace

description: AYU the (Ayu branded tea) makes tasty bespoke blends of tea (strawberry, ginger honey, etc). They're available at the Good Market on Thursdays or by delivery. Good either hot or cold.
directions: If it's Thursday, head down the Parliament Road out of Colombo to Waters Edge. They have a stall there. Otherwise call.
name: AYU the

description: Pasco Food Blush is a new eatery that has recently come up on Pannipitiya road in Battaramulla. Its only a few meters away from where Coco Citrine used to be (theyve been replaced by La Trattoria a fancy new Italian restaurant). If youre driving past Food Blush in the night, its pretty hard to miss - theres a bright neon sign and a big screen out in the courtyard facing the road.
name: Pasco Food Blush

description: We heard good things about Spicy Cabin, but our experience simply wasn't that good.
directions: From Baseline Road, turn down the Nawala Road (opposite Kirula) and pass the bridge. It's after the curve, past the El Cardo. From Nawala take what is then called the Narahenpita Road up about 200 meters.
name: Spicy Cabin

description: The Lagoon is a fine dining seafood restaurant located in Colombo's Cinnamon Grand Hotel. Freshly caught seafood is displayed upon a bed of ice and can be chosen with the preferred style of preparation and sides. It's very good, and very expensive.
directions: Go north on Galle Road past Colpetty Junction, past the Prez's house and turn right into the Cinnamon Grand. If you walk thru the lobby and past Coffee Stop, Lagoon is outside and down the stairs.
name: The Lagoon (Cinnamon Grand)

description: Yue Chuan is a fine dining Chinese restaurant located at the Kingsbury hotel. The food is good, but not excellent.
directions: Yue Chuan is on the ground floor of The Kingsbury Hotel.
name: Yue Chuan (Kingsbury)

description: Tsing Tao is a fine dinning Chinese restaurant that strikes a good a balance between authentic and Sri Lankanized Chinese, in a chic and elegant setting.
address: Race Course Promenade, Reid Avenue, Colombo 7
directions: The Racecourse is across the street from Royal College on Reid Avenue (officially Philip Gunewardena). From Independence Avenue you can turn right opposite Maitland Crescent. There's parking. You can also walk here from Independence Square, just follow the road past Sri Lanka Foundation Institute.
name: Tsing Tao (Colombo Racecourse)

description: La Trattoria is an Italian restaurant in Battaramulla replacing Coco Citrine. It's very expensive, but the food is decent.
directions: Pass Waters Edge and Sethsiripaya and head into Battaramulla Town. After the Arpico, turn right at the junction (towards Pannipitiya). La Trattoria is about 1 km down the road, before Pasco Food Blush.
name: La Trattoria

description: The Cakery used to be a resident favourite amongst the plebs at office, but they've long since dwindled in terms of service and food.
directions: Turn to Sulaiman Terrace from Jawatte Rd. The Cakery is about 50m down the lane.
name: The Cakery

description: SaBaBa's is basically the only place on Whiskey Point. It's run by Mambo's brother and is pretty chill. It's underground (no website/Facebook/etc), but if you show up they'll serve you.
address: Whiskey Point, Arugam Bay, Eastern Province
directions: It's a bit of a trek. You'd need to take a trishaw past Pottuvil town, continue on the main road till you see lagoon on your left, then take a right and head towards the beach.
name: SaBaBa's

description: Butter Boutique has moved now! They're officially setting up shop at Rosmead Place so we went to check them out.
directions: It's just up from Wijerama Mw on Rosmead Place.
name: Butter Boutique

description: Coffee Stop at the Cinnamon Grand serves high quality short-eats, sandwiches, cakes and confectionary. It's open til 2 AM every day.
name: Coffee Stop (Cinnamon Grand)

description: Big Bite in Mount Lavinia is one of the few places where you can get yourself a proper Pakistani biriyani. It's spicier than most, but it's still damn good, specially coupled with their barbequed chicken.
directions: Proceed along Galle Road south, past Hotel Road and the Cargills/KFC. It's on the corner of Dakshinarama Road.
name: Big Bite (Mount Lavinia)

description: Gecko is a restaurant/hotel located on the highly popular main strip of Arugam Bay. They have a great seafront location with chilled out seating and good food, but the service is terrible.
directions: Going along Main Street, Gecko is just past Hideway, before Siam View.
name: Gecko

description: Hideaway is the best restaurant and probably the best hotel in Arugam Bay. It has excellent food and accommodation and thoughtful family management.
directions: Heading down Main Street, Hideaway is across from the big Bay Vista, down from Tri Star and just before Gecko's. It's on the land side.
name: Hideaway Villas

description: Curve, at Park Street Mews, is a tapas bar that's been around for a couple of years. While the purple-white theme is looking a bit old now, their tapas and drinks are still pretty good.
directions: From Dharmapala Mawatha, turn down Park Street, past Cotton Collection if you're heading east. Also accessible from Hyde Park Corner, or through Hunupitiya. To Park you pass the Mews, turn left on the next main road, then left again on Lake Crescent, doubling back to the parking lot behind.
name: Curve

description: On the corner of Dockyard's and St. Mary's (depending) Rizwan runs a good wade cart. He's got manioc chips, fried garlic, and those little wade balls. He's a nice guy, the food is fresh and just different enough from Colombo stuff to be interesting.
name: Rizwan's Wade Cart (Trinco)

description: Swyree is a little spot near Orr's Hill which serves a great Kottu and fried frice. East coast kottu is different and this place is worth a try.
directions: From Orr's Hill, take the Kandy Road away from town, it's before the petrol shed and across from the vegetables stand.
name: Swyree

description: Sweetberry is a small juice bar which specializes in berries (strawberries, raspberries, blackberries, blueberries, etc).
directions: From Havelock Road, turn down Dickman's Road and take the second right down De Fonseka. It's about 100m down, past Qbaa. From Duplication Road, you can go up Visaka and right on De Fon or up De Fonseka Place (past House of Fashion) and then onto De Fonseka Rd.
name: Sweetberry

description: This stall serves a variety of stuff - from nai miris to pollos cutlets to dim sum. It's all very good.
directions: Head down the Parliament Road till you get to Water's Edge, just before Battaramulla. You'll see the market on your left.
name: Warehouse Project

description: As far as beach bars go, Shore By O! is by far the most popular. Not all their drinks are excellent, but they do the best beer cocktails around and their bites arent too shabby either.
directions: From Galle Road, take Hotel Road towards the Mount Lavinia Hotel. Turn right onto College Avenue. They have some parking at the end of College Ave, or you can park before or down De Saram. Walk to the end of College Ave, cross the rail tracks and you're there.
name: The Shore By O!

description: Cafe Shaze is another one of Colombo's many cafe-restaurant-lounges. They serve the usual Western dishes, mocktails and coffees - the food is alright and it's pretty much on par with other cafes.
directions: From Havelock Road, turn up Thimbirigasaya. It's about 200 meters on your left, right after Calorie Counter.
name: Cafe Shaze

description: This not-so-little bakery is Ragamas answer to Dinemore, McDonalds, Roots and KFC.
directions: If you're in Ragama, Thewatta Road is the turn near the flyover and the clock tower. Sisira Bakers is right in front of the railway station.
name: Sisira Bakers

description: To quote the Notorious BIG, it looks like Softlogic is representing BK to the fullest. The Whopper tastes authentic, the service is competent and the location is well equipped and smart. The restaurant doesn't go beyond the usual Burger King flavor, but it's not supposed to. It's very new, but we'd say that this franchise hits the mark.
directions: Head down the Galle Road towards Mt. Lavinia. It's on the seaside past the Arpico and before Hotel Road.
name: Burger King (Mount Lavinia)

description: Mitsi's Cafe was one of those hidden gems we uncovered in 2013. One year down the line, the food is still good, the service is friendly and the desserts are exceptional.
directions: From Duplication Road, turn left and go up Bagatalle past Charles Place. From Thurstand, turn left at Midnight Divas and take the left fork down Bagatalle, it's near the Malaysian Embassy.
name: Mitsi's Delicacies

description: Kash's Kitchen is a very clean restaurant and pastry shop in Ambalantota. It serves great rice and curry and short eats at affordable prices.
directions: Driving down the Colombo - Hambantota main road, there will be a vast paddy field to your left just as you're entering Ambalangoda town. Kash's Kitchen will be to your right.
name: Kash's Kitchen (Ambalantota)

description: Fortaleza is a nice modern addition to the Galle Fort. They have simple and tasty food, excellent service and a beautiful, hip location. We wish it was in Colombo.
directions: Enter the Galle Fort and turn left at the roundabout (you have to). Continue down Church Street past Amangalla, PAST the Dutch Church and turn right before the All Saints Church. It's at the end of that road.
name: Fortaleza

description: 41 Sugar might be pricier than  other contemporary bars, but both its cocktails and food are honestly excellent. With an excellent rooftop setting to boot, the only thing they really need to fix is the attitude of their staff.
directions: From Horton Place, head down Maitland Crescent at the Coffee Bean. You can't drive to it from the Independence Ave side, but you can park there and walk.
name: 41 Sugar

description: Upali's does affordable and tasty Sri Lankan food.
directions: Upali's is on the road to Town Hall past the Alexandra Roundabout (where Horton Place and Nelum Pokuna meet).
name: Upali's

description: Caked is a home bakery specialising in french macarons, cupcakes and cakes. French macarons are notoriously difficult to master, but they do an excellent job.
directions: Caked currently does pick up. If you follow Havelock Road to where it forks (becoming High Level Road), then go to the right, past the Pizza Hut. Murugan Place is the second road to your right, just past Microimage.
name: Caked

description: The old Alerics is finally back with a new location in (the also new) Liberty Arcade. It's a bit artificial, but good for a hot day's treat.
directions: The Liberty Arcade is just past Liberty Plaza, at the beginning of Duplication Road. You can park in the Liberty Parking lot. Inside the arcade, it's basically in the lobby.
name: Alerics

description: Tintagel is a historic Colombo establishment with chic design and generally good (but pricey) food at its al fresco restaurant.
directions: Tintagel is on Rosmead Place just above Wijerama and below Kynsey Road. From Ward Place, turn right on Wijerama and then Rosmead is your next left. From Horton Place, turn onto Wijerama and turn right onto Rosmead (second street).
name: The Courtyard (Tintagel Boutique Hotel)

description: (Reopened)Gloria Jean's has made a comeback despite the scandals surrounding their local franchises. They're at Horton Place now where the old Barista used to be, a few steps across the road from Coffee Bean right next to the W Lounge.
directions: It's  at Horton Place across the road from Coffee Bean, next to the W Lounge where the old Barista used to be.
name: Gloria Jean's Coffees

description: YUMI is Taj Samudra's resident Japanese restaurant. What they lack in terms of variety they make up for with some delicious, specialized sushi in arguably the best setting for a Japanese restaurant in Colombo.
address: Taj Samudra, 25 Galle Face Center Rd, Colombo 3
directions: The Taj is across from the Galle Face Green right near the junction. You can access it from the Galle Road or from Macan Markar Mawatha, through the parking lot below. If you walk through the lobby YUMI is to your right. If you come from below you can also take the stairs up to the pool and enter that way.
name: YUMI (Taj Samudra)

description: We had a great time here. It's a friendly spot on the beach, very near Colombo, with good Chinese food. Doesn't get much better.
directions: On Marine Drive, keep heading south until you pass the Dehiwala Canal and basically can't go anymore. It's on your right. From Galle Road, turn down at the William Grinding Mills junction.
name: Barracuda

description: Simply Strawberries makes wonderful desserts and their new outlet on Dharmapala Mawatha serves the same products in a more central and less busy location. Win.
directions: From Liberty Roundabout, head up Dharmapala Mawatha past the Sampath Bank, past Kelly Felder and turn into Cotton Collection. Coming from Town Hall side is more difficult in a car. You'll need to go down Park Street and do a bit of a round.
name: Simply Strawberries By Jagro (Cotton Collection)

description: Whight & Co is amazing for coffee. They've got Cold Drip down to a science. The food is alright, too.
address: Marine Drive and Aloe Avenue, Colombo 3
directions: It's on the Colpetty side of Marine Drive. From Galle Road, go past the McDonald's and turn down Aloe Avenue just past ACBT. On Marine Drive it's between the Marina Casino on the North and Arabian Knights on the south.
name: Whight & Co

description: Delicieux is a vegan home baker based roughly out of Nugegoda. Despite not using milk or eggs, she makes some tasty sweets.
directions: Delicieux sometimes has bake sales at the Amro Cafe in Nugegoda. For regular orders the pick-up is in Borella. Email delicieuxcakery@gmail.com.
name: Delicieux (Vegan Home Baker)

description: The Brick Lane Cookie Companie serves fresh cookies between the escalators of the Crescat Mall. It's a quick and tasty bite you can grab on your way up or down.
directions: You can enter the Crescat Mall from the Galle Road, turning into the Cinnamon Grand (between Galle Face Green and Colpetty Junction) or from the back, going around the Beira Lake. Brick Lane Cookies is in the downstairs food court, between the escalators.
name: The Brick Lane Cookie Company (Crescat)

description: A worthy and chocolate heavy addition to our reviews of Colombo home bakers. Very tasty and indulgent sweets, mainly brownies.
name: Dark Temptations (Home Baker)

description: As a food, McDonald's is pretty processed and nothing special, but as an experience it still has a real place in the global psyche. Sometimes you just want McDonald's. In that case the Colpetty outlet serves the usual McD fare with a few Sri Lankan twists.
directions: From Kollupitiya junction, head up Galle Road. It's past Durdan's and around Pilawoos.
name: McDonald's (Colpetty)

description: The new address they relocated to is easily accessible and there is plenty of parking. From a food POV, it may not impress everyone but the place sure is somewhere we can all relax at.
directions: The Paddington is on Barnes Place between the Town Hall road and Wijerama Mawatha. It's near Musaeus so watch out for school time.
name: The Paddington

description: Healthy and tasty juices for Rs. 200.
directions: On Saturdays, check out the Racecourse via the Independence Square side or by heading from Vihara Maha Devi and down Reid Ave.
name: Gami Gedara

description: The Verandah Bistro is a lesser known hotel restaurant on the third floor of the Hilton Residences. It does average hotel food with a nice poolside view.
directions: Head down Union Place (from the ODEL junction) and the Hilton Residences (formerly JAIC) is on your left, past the KFC.
name: Verandah Bistro & Bar

description: Salad Guru is a fun little new enterprise trying its wings at the Good Market. Run by a trained nutritionist, the stall has a whole range of stuff thats good for you. They range from salads, pastas and soups to quiches and healthy tacos.
name: Salad Guru

description: The Kingsbury buffet is pretty good. It's the best in terms of salads and veg, highly competitive in seafood, and good for everything else. It's Rs. 3,500 all in. We think it's good value.
directions: Take the Galle Road north until it ends (past the Galle Face Green) at a roundabout. That giant building you're looking at is the Kingsbury. Go inside and proceed towards the ocean till you get to the restaurant.
name: Harbour Court (Kingsbury)

description: Gelato down Pedlar's Street
directions: Head to the heart of Galle Fort, Pedlar Street.
name: Pedlar's Inn Gelato (Galle)

description: Ginza On The Edge is the suburban successor to the Hiltons  Ginza Hohsen. It's on the 1st floor of Waters Edge and offers high-end Japanese with excellent service to boot.
directions: Come towards Battaramulla on Rajagiriya Road, turn left after the Diyatha Uyana to the Waters Edge Entrance. Walk in up the main stairs and before entering the lobby, turn right, towards the wooden staircase. Ginza is up these stairs, at the end of a long carpet corridor.
name: Ginza On The Edge (Waters Edge)

description: Started by Cherine Amarasinghe and her husband Karu, Cherines Quench caters bottles of delicious icy beverages  ice coffee, naarang juice, and gingerbeer. Using all natural ingredients and bottled daily, the drinks are fresh and dont contain any additives.
directions: The shop is on your immediate left inside Lakpahana grounds - Lakpahana is just opposite the Racecourse building, which is between the CCC Ground and the University of Colombo.
name: Cherine's Quench

description: Great Wall has been around for a while now, but they're mostly known for their take out. We dropped by for lunch to see how they match up against the growing number of Chinese restaurants in Colombo.
directions: On Galle Road, passing Buller's Road junction, just as you turn into Edward Lane.
name: Great Wall

description: A chilled out place in the heart of Colombo for a nibble and drink after work with friends, which doesn't require you to dress up or shell out serious dough.
directions: Mintage is at the very beginning of Kynsey Road when you turn in from the Borella Junction.
name: Mintage Restaurant & Pub

description: A pure vegetarian North & South Indian restaurant, cafe and bakery, Mangos is one of those famous Jaffna joints that warrants a visit and a mention.
directions: Smack on Temple Road, Mangos is right down the road from the Nallur Kovil.
name: Mangos (Jaffna)

description: Streat360 is an interesting little restaurant featuring 'street food' from different countries. The interior is quite chic and rustic, but it's kinda overpriced.
directions: Go up Ward Place from the ODEL roundabout, past Cargills, Samsaung and Wijerama Mawatha - you'll find a by-lane on your right marked by the sign 'Streat360'. The restaurant is right at the end.
name: Streat360

description: Hotel Rolex and its misleading name are an experience not to be missed whilst in Jaffna. Hot, juicy biriyanis and sugary juices. This is legit Northern saivar kade territory.
directions: It's right behind the mini bus-stand. There are about 6 name boards surrounding it, impossible to miss.
name: Hotel Rolex (Jaffna)

description: A well run Burger King franchise with a nice location (second floor balcony) in Colpetty. They also have interesting local options like spicy chicken and rice now.
directions: It's on Galle Road just across from the Hotel Renuka and on Mile Post Avenue. If you're heading north on Galle Road (you have to, one way) it's just past Abdul Cafoor Mawatha. From Marine Drive your last chance to merge up is 17th Ave or Sellamuttu Ave.
name: Burger King (Colpetty)

description: Colombo Courtyard's design and style are brilliant, as we've mentioned before in the hotel review. It's chic, it's tasteful, and a lot of it is upcycled. The food, on the other hand, leaves a lot to be desired.
name: Colombo Courtyard Poolside

description: The Light House Galley opposite Colombo Lighthouse is a courtyard-restaurant run by the Navy - it's a good place for lunch or dinner.
directions: Turn into the left-most road at the Kingsbury roundabout, it's right opposite the Lighthouse tower.
name: Light House Galley

description: Panino specialises in sandwiches. In melts, to be specific. They also have a killer hot sauce.
directions: Inside the Cotton Collection premises, opposite Vihara Mahadevi Park.
name: Panino (Cotton Collection)

description: Chutneys serves good South Indian fare, with a menu neatly divided between the four Southern states' vegetarian and non-vegetarian cuisines. The food is quite authentic, with brilliant quality and questionable quantity.
directions: The Cinnamon Grand is on the Galle Road between Galle Face Green and Kollupitiya Junction.
name: Chutneys  (Cinnamon Grand)

description: For candy enthusiasts, Candy Planet in Battaramulla is the holy grail - not only is it affordable but you will find every imaginable type of candy there. It is probably as close as we Sri Lankans will ever get to Willy Wonka's chocolate factory.
directions: Pass the Battaramulla junction and go straight down Kaduwela road - you'll find it at the top of Bogahahena Road.
name: Candy Planet

description: Che By Relish is a lounge/restaurant that serves well prepared food, is on the high-end, and has its walls covered with Che Guevera memorabilia.
directions: Stratford avenue is at the Kirulapone junction, you walk down the road and you'll find it near the huge Gandhara store.
name: Che By Relish

description: Dinemore in Wellawatte by the sea has got their signature oozing-mayo subs and burgers, with a relaxing view of the ocean.
directions: Find Boswell Place on Galle Road, it'll be somewhat opposite the Commercial Bank ATM and Hotel Sapphire. Go down through Boswell Place to Marine Drive and it's right there on the left.
name: Dinemore (Marine Drive)

description: Xilaton is a Chinese restaurant in Bambalapitiya - the service is good and so is the food. We're especially fans of their hot garlic prawns which - get this - are slathered in cheese.
directions: It's near the Police Park on Havelock Road, next to Amrith Indian restaurant.
name: Xilaton

description: Latitude at Taj Samudra offers one of the more expensive lunch buffets in Colombo. While they dont particularly specialise in a particular area, they offer a satisfying spread overall.
address: Taj Samudra, Galle Face Center Road, Colombo 3
directions: Go straight past the Galle Face roundabout (on the Galle Road) and you'll see it on your right.
name: Latitude (Buffet, Taj)

description: Ever been to one of those places where you ate so much, you had to just stop and rest a bit? Those kind of places are harder to come by now since food in general is too expensive, but at long last we found another in Chennai restaurant. You can pretty much stuff your face full of tasty Indian dishes and it'll cost you less than Rs.400, guaranteed.
directions: On Galle Road, just before the Kovil, at the turn off to Lorenz Road.
name: Chennai

description: Semondu is Sri Lankan airlines' attempt at semi-fine dining (yup, that's a word now). They serve up continental fusion cuisine, and for the most part, they do it well.
directions: It's the first restaurant on your left as you come in through the main entrance at Dutch hospital (opposite the World Trade Center)
name: Semondu (Dutch Hospital)

description: Since the only proper food courts we've had in the city have been at Crescat, Excel World, Liberty and Majestic City - it's with great relief that we welcome the new one at the brand spanking new Arcade Independence Square. We think the atmosphere especially and the food here is a little notch above that of your average Colombo food court.
directions: The Arcade is right opposite the Post Office on the Avenue - the big white buildings and fountains will be hard to miss. When you enter, look for the central fountains - the seating space on the right of it is just outside the food court.
name: Arcade Food Court

description: Noodles at Cinnamon Grand offers one the most complete dining experiences around the city at a surprisingly affordable price point, while maintaining a high level service.
address: Cinnamon Grand Colombo, 77, Galle Road, Colombo 3
directions: Cinnamon Grand is between Temple Trees and Galle Face on the Galle Road. Inside, walk into the lobby, turn right, go past Coffee Stop and the shoe shine place and down the stairs. Keep going forward and it's there.
name: Noodles (Cinnamon Grand)

description: The Boulevard, formerly a cafe/restuarant, has been completely revamped into what we'd consider one of the top Thai restaurants in Colombo. With chef Mama (former head chef at Royal Thai) at the fore, as well as some outstanding food, this is one place to keep an eye on.
directions: On Duplication Road turn right on Queen's Road (passing Queen's cafe), The Boulevard is on the left of the lane opposite Divine Bakery.
name: The Boulevard

description: Drunken Monkey is a popular restaurant and bar in Hikkaduwa, and one of the couple of places that still function during off-season. The food is average but it's a great place to hang out by the beach.
directions: As you go further South down Galle Road, it's before Narigama Pathana road, on your right - opposite a big white guest house called Le Reve D'Hikka. The Drunken Monkey sign board is next to one that says Hotel International Beach and Restaurant.
name: Drunken Monkey

description: Tang Dynasty  is one of the most authentic ones we've been to, the interior is amazing and the food is top notch.
directions: It's on Dickman's Road, right before the De Fonseka Road turn-off (when coming from Havelock Road).
name: Tang Dynasty

description: Empire Cafe is a little restaurant-cum-cafe housed inside the Olde Empire Hotel, a 200 year old building, right next to the Dalada Maligawa in Kandy. It's a popular tourist hangout, is surprisingly affordable, and has the best chocolate cake we've had in ages.
directions: Temple Street is off D S Senanayake Street and like the name suggests, very close to the Dalada Maligawa temple. Go down the street, pass Pizza Hut and opposite the flower stalls you'll find a very old looking building titled Olde Empire Hotel on your left.
name: Empire Cafe

description: The Governor's Restaurant at Mt.Lavinia Hotel offers one of the better buffets in the city. We found that mostly everything tasted good, with an exceptional salad bar and arguably the best selection of desserts around.
address: No 100, Hotel Road, Mount Lavinia, Sri Lanka.
directions: Coming down Galle Road, turn to Hotel Road (the road that leads down from ODEL), Mount Lavinia hotel is at the very end. Pretty hard to miss.
name: Mount Lavinia Hotel Buffet

description: Cafe Orange Peel is less of a cafe and more of a very sophisticated bath-kadey - it is a popular new stop for the working crowd in Bambalapitiya. Their rice and curry is top class and comes in epic portions.
directions: It's past the Mothercare showroom, right opposite Ashik and Baskin Robbins.
name: Cafe Orange Peel

description: Cafe Asiana is an established affordable restaurant down Hill Street that, as the name suggests, serves Sri Lankanized Asian food - their portions are huge and their seafood is spicy and delicious.
directions: Turn into Hill Street at the Dehiwala junction and keep going - Cafe Asiana is just before Malay Restaurant, on your left.
name: Cafe Asiana

description: Pedlar's Inn Cafe is a popular stop in Galle fort (and so is their Gelato opposite the cafe) - the food is alright, but mostly it's the ambience that makes this place appealing, though there are better spots with better food in the Fort these days.
directions: You can get to Pedlar's Street either from Rampart Street, Hospital Street or Light House Street - it's in the same neighborhood as Barista and Heritage Cafe.
name: Pedlar's Inn Cafe

description: Swift service and healthy veggie options make Subway a worthy new franchise in Colombo.
address: 347, R. A. De Mel Mawatha, Colombo 03
directions: It's just past Mahanama College, on the corner of Walukarama Road and Duplication Road.
name: Subway

description: Sigiri is a small but excellent Sri Lankan restaurant located in Manhattan, New York serving an authentic and impressive representation of Lankan cuisine.
name: Sigiri (Manhattan, New York)

description: Queen's Cafe is a very popular fast food stop down Duplication Road that's been around for ages. It was closed for a while awaiting a face lift, but it's now open for business again.
directions: It's right next to Fashion Bug, between Queen's Road and the British Council road. It's accessible from Galle Road through Alfred House Gardens.
name: Queen's Cafe

description: Domenico's, headed by the former chef at Santore was great addition to Colombo's pizza scene in 2014. Now they've expanded their menu with some much needed meats and it's that much better.
directions: Coming down Thimbirigasyaya Rd, past the Fife Rd turn off, Domenico's is opposite wow.lk office (formerly anything.lk)
name: Domenico's

description: The Bread Company does excellent breads, sausages, pickles and more, and they do some of the  best sandwiches in the city and a good breakfast if you want to dine in.
directions: Coming down Thimibirigasyaya Road, past St. Theresa's Church (heading east). Its about 100m past the church, opposite Mas Gourmet (its a grocery store with bright orange paint).
name: The Bread Company (German Artisan Bakers)

description: We've seen their brownies pop up on our news feed more than a few times.  So this time we made it a point to give Treats n Stuff a shot.  We can now see why they've got such a large following.
directions: Coming down Galle Rd (Bamabalapitiya side), St. Peter's place is on sea side past St. Peter's College, juts before the bridge.
name: Treats n Stuff

description: Zion Fountain Cafe is a little bath kade type eatery that's on the same premises as the Zion Christian Church. They serve rice, short-eats, smoothies and cake for affordable prices, and it's actually a pretty popular stop for school-goers in the neighborhood.
directions: Just before you reach Thalakotuwa Gardens on Elvitigala Mawatha, you'll see the big semi-circular sign of the Zion Center on your left.
name: Zion Fountain Cafe

description: Wonderland is an ice cream and smoothie joint in Malabe that has a huge range of stuff on their menu, and it's quite cheap too. Their smoothie glasses are tall and they've got cool flavours like Milo and bubblegum. It is all the way in Malabe though, so all you people in central Colombo, suck it up.
directions: It's right after the Malabe bus stop and Malabe junction, after Pizza Hut - on your left, near the Supul complex.
name: Wonderland

description: Agra is another one of those rare fine dining Indian restaurants in Colombo. They're not cheap but we think their food is definitely worth the price.
name: Agra

description: Consider yourself a bona fide carnivore? Well then Backyard BBQ is just what you're looking for. They're a barbecue specialist in Mt.Lavinia that does delivery and take-out. They've got a great selection of western barbecue at a pretty good price.
name: Backyard BBQ

description: Chana's has been gaining popularity for sometime now and it's easy to see why. They do a pretty good take on North Indian cuisine and their biriyani is one of the best in town.
directions: Coming down Galle Rd, turn to W.A .Silva Mw. Chana's is about 200m down the road (Before Royal Hospital and Al-Maas).
name: Chana's

description: Pranzo has an amazing view and serves pretty good Italian and 'Sritalian' fare.
address: 316, Polduwa Rd, Ethul Kotte Road, Battaramulla
directions: Head along the Diyawanna Oya towards Kotte, and turn left just around the Diyatha Uyana white tents. Keep going left till you see the lake of lotus flowers, turn right, and you'll end up at Waters Edge - Pranzo is in the main lobby.
name: Pranzo (Waters Edge)

description: Aahaara is a caterer that does wood-fired biriyani and rice and curry.
directions: Go down Galle Road towards Dehiwala. Initium Road is the road right opposite St. Mary's Church, on the seaside. Aahaara is situated at the end of this road.
name: Aahaara

description: Colombo has a ton of Chinese eateries, but Tong Ni BBQ hidden away on Walukarama Road (behind Subway), is one that is truly unique. The food is good and you get to see it being cooked right on your table. It may not suit everyone but we found it entertaining.
directions: Coming down Duplication Rd past Mahanama College, turn to Walukarama Road ( Road next to Subway). Tong Ni BBQ is at the back of the road right in front of the Walukaramaya Raja Maha Viharaya.
name: Tong Ni BBQ

description: Theva Cuisine is of Kandy's few good restaurants. With great breads, excellent dessert and friendly service, it's definitely worth a visit.
directions: Turn into Keppetipola Road from the main street near Kandy's Central Market - go straight into Hantana Road and follow your Google Map closely as you go up the uphill path. Theva is in the 5th lane on your left. Pass the staircase to the terrace and the restaurant is through the door on your left.
name: Theva Cuisine

description: Monster Cookies is a home baker that does a variety of cookies and since of late, brownies as well. We tried out some of their more interesting choices and we were all smiles.
directions: Coming down Galle Road, Dr. E.A. Cooray Mw is the first lane (seaside) after Arpico. Monster Cookies is at No.10, which is a house at the top of the lane. There's no sign so look for the number.
name: Monster Cookies

description: Kandoori is an Indian restaurant that serves just biriyani and other Indian food.
directions: Charlemont Road is the lane right before the Savoy theatre - the restaurant is a 10 minute walk in.
name: Kandoori

description: The grandly named New Star Hotel is a little street kade on the Galle Road of Dehiwala that serves up a mean iced milo, biriyani and kottu. It's a good stop for a cheap, tasty lunch, if you don't mind the dodginess.
directions: If you're heading in the Bamba-Dehiwala direction, it's on your left, just before St Mary's Church, opposite Crystal supermarket.
name: New Star Hotel

description: For those looking for healthy food in Colombo, the choices are limited, but The Salad Bar in Rajagiriya is looking to change that. They're a tiny stall that offers a range of salads at affordable rates. The best part is that they actually deliver.
directions: On Parliment Rd, right next to the Keells Super in the same space as Paan Paan and Juiceez.
name: The Salad Bar

description: Sugar Bistro Galle Fort is a smaller rendition of Sugar Bistro and Wine Bar in Colombo, serving the same great food and drank at a stylish new address at the Galle Dutch Hospital.
directions: Head into Colombo Fort, turn down Queens Street and park at Magistrate's Square. Walk down Hospital Road and there you are.
name: Sugar Bistro Galle Fort
