description: Bilal Hotel is a little kade on Bamba's Galle Road that serves kottu, fried rice, biriyani and the likes. The prices are low and the kottu is super cheesey.
directions: This is right opposite Majestic City on Galle Road, just after MD Gunasena, and before Hotel de Majestic.
name: Bilal Hotel

description: Pink Sugar is a new home baker which remixes classic flavors like  Oreo, Ferrero Rocher and Irish cream.
directions: Pick up is from Nandana Gardens which is almost opposite the Bambalapitiya Flats, and after St Paul's Church Milagiriya.
name: Pink Sugar

description: Buth Amma's Buth Kade is a hole-in-the-wall rice and curry spot in Bamba, run out of a family home for 68 years.
directions: This place is between Romafour and Unity Plaza, on the land side. It's a tiny little lane you might miss unless you're on your feet. Watch out for the hand-painted green sign.
name: Buth Amma

description: So among all the delivery joints thankfully cropping up in Colombo for the benefit of those of us who want to eat lazily at home, Choco Luv has made itself known as an unlikely contender in the realm of pizza delivery.
directions: It's delivery from their outlet on Gregory's Road.
name: Choco Luv Pizza Delivery

description: Frozen is a 'gourmet' ice cream place at Urban Kitchen. The prices are fine and they've got some interesting options on their menu.
address: Arpico Super Store, 69, Hyde Park Corner, Colombo 02
directions: Head down Dharmapala Mawatha along Viharamahadevi Park, and turn left at the Lipton Circus roundabout. Hyde Park Corner is on your first left down this road. Drive into the Arpico premises and when you walk into Urban Kitchen, Frozen is the first stall on your right.
name: Frozen

description: A little rooftop spot in the Fort serving up a variety of crepes.
directions: If you're driving best to park near the Lighthouse, along the ramparts (you can take the road along the south side of the Fort and through the Dutch Hospital). Walk up the street past the mosque (Leyn Baan) and it's just after the first junction. In the evenings you go upstairs.
name: Crepeology

description: CuppaCreme is a home baker who is amazing at choc biscuit pudding and red velvet cupcakes.
address: 15A, Robert Road, off Quarry Road, Dehiwala
directions: Robert Road is right off the middle of Quarry Road, near Park Road. It's a five-minute drive into this road.
name: CuppaCreme

description: Giovanni's is a little Italian pizza place run by a chef who uses his own recipes, and serves fresh from a clay oven.
directions: It's just opposite Moon River Chinese restaurant on Thimbirigasyaya Road, near Sen Saal and Jawatte Road.
name: Giovanni's

description: Ambrosia does baked goodies, but they're not a home baker. They're a company, but the stuff we had was made by a very skilled hand and given the special attention that only home bakers are known to give.
directions: This road is just past the Borella junction and Punchi Theatre.
name: Ambrosia

description: The Sweet Tooth or TST, is a small home baker that specializes in jars full of baked goods. We tried a bunch of different jars (along with some other stuff) and they were all pretty great.
directions: TST will let you know the address and directions when you place the order.
name: The Sweet Tooth

description: Icebear Century Cafe is a very cool place to chill out at in Negombo - it's a quirky hangout and novelty shop in an old house.
directions: If you're heading away from town, you'll find the cafe on your right, down Main Street, after St Mary's Church and the Negombo post office.
name: IceBear Century Cafe (Negombo)

description: Prego is an Italian restaurant in Negombo. Although the prices are high, the food is quite authentic and the ambience is chilled out.
directions: The restaurant is down Lewis Place, near Jetwing Ayurveda. It's right next to that weird Negombo roundabout with the sculpture of two dolphins and a crustacean.
name: Prego

description: We dropped in at the Java Lounge in Bambalapitiya the other day, and it's actually pretty good. They've got an accessible location, good coffee and some awesome desserts.
directions: Coming down Galle Road past the Bambalapitya Flats, Lava Lounge shares the premises with the Kapruka store.
name: Java Lounge (Bambalapitiya)

description: The Sweeter Side is another home baker - the prices are fine, the cakes are a bit bread-texture, we like the fudge brownies.
directions: It's close to the Open University just before the bridge.
name: The Sweeter Side

description: Top Secret is a very cool beach hangout in Hikkaduwa. We loved the ambience and the food is good without  being too pricey.
directions: It's on the Galle Road beach stretch, near the International Beach Hotel and Blue Moon.
name: Top Secret Beach Restaurant (Hikkaduwa)

description: A Minute By Tuk is a little eatery in the Galle Dutch Hospital. The ambience is cool since it's up on a deck, but the food is pricey and just okay.
address: Old Hospital Building, Galle Fort, Galle
directions: At the first roundabout inside the fort, go left, pass the Dutch Church and turn left on Queens St. Keep going till that road curves past the Magistrate's Square and turns into Hospital Street. Park there and walk forward to the Old Dutch Hospital. This is on the first floor, at the front of the courtyard.
name: A Minute By Tuk (Galle Dutch Hospital)

description: China Town is a little restaurant on Marine Drive that serves big sloppy portions of spicy Sri Lankan-Chinese and even some Indian.
directions: Sea Avenue on Galle Road is near Nations Trust Bank and The Fab. Chinatown is on the street's Marine Drive end.
name: China Town

description: Peking Palace in Nawala serves up some decent Sri Lankanized Chinese cuisine at an accessible location.
directions: Peking Palace is past the Nawala Junction and Arpico Home Concepts, right next to the Cargills Food City
name: Peking Palace

description: Their coconut chutney lifts to high heavens an otherwise mediocre array of South Indian staples.
directions: Right opposite Carnival ice cream and National Savings Bank, just before the Kollupitiya junction.
name: Indo Ceylon Cafe

description: We order from McDonald's far more than we probably should, but that's because their delivery is efficient, reliable and quite fast!
name: McDonald's Delivery (McDelivery)

description: Dairy King is a good place to stop by for ice cream - and fat chocolatey brownies - if you're in Galle Fort.
directions: Church Street is very near the Mosque on Rampart street, just walk into the street from the rampart side and you'll see pink and blue walls on your right.
name: Dairy King

description: Cafe Hula Hula near the ramparts of Galle Fort serves good kottu, tasty seafood, and - yay! - we found great eclairs here.
directions: It's just where Rampart Street meets Pedlar Street, opposite the rampart.
name: Cafe Hula Hula (Galle)

description: The Brick Lane Cookie Company opened up their newest stall in Fort a couple of weeks ago. We tried a bunch of their cookies along with their interesting new additions, and they were all pretty great.
directions: Brick Lane is at the entrance of the Colombo City Hotel, right opposite the WTC.
name: The Brick Lane Cookie Company (Fort)

description: Cakes & Things by Windya is a home baker in Mount Lavinia. Her specialty is theme cakes, but her cupcakes and brownies are pretty great as well.
directions: From Galle Road turn to Templers Road in Mount Lavinia. Cakes & Things is on Kalapura Rd, at the end of Templers Rd.
name: Cakes & Things By Windya (Mt.Lavinia)

description: Mamas Guest House is a decent place to stop by for rice and curry and other meals in the Galle Fort. It's cosy and you can meet Mama herself.
address: 67, Small Cross Street, off Church Street, Galle Fort, Galle
directions: Get close to the rampart side of the fort - Mamas Guest House is in the first by-lane to your right if you enter Church Street from the ramparts.
name: Mamas Galle Fort Guest House

description: Rocket Burger is the Galle Fort's only burger specialist.  The patties are well ground and they're usually very generous with stuffing -  you're going to spend Rs. 900 minimum for a burger here though.
directions: Just head down Pedlars Street towards Hospital Street. It's about a block away from The Heritage Cafe, next to the Three By TPV store.
name: The Original Rocket Burger

description: Anzu's restaurant on Marine Drive (Colpetty) is a new and authentic Chinese eating house. While it may not suit everyone, it's a good option for those looking to experience Chinese home cooking.
directions: Anzu's Restaurant is on Marine Drive right before Hotel Sun Hill and Palmyrah Av (even though it says it's on it).
name: Anzu's Restaurant (Huang Xiang Ju)

description: Sweet Layers is a home baker based in Piliyandala. They offer a range of baked goods, but their pastries are what really sets them apart.
directions: Sweet Layers is past the Bokundara junction and Food city, turn to Nilani Gardens. It's small lane next to a big blue building. It's house No. 2 down the lane.Best bet is to call them and get directions from Bokundara junction.
name: Sweet Layers

description: The Tuna & The Crab is a mainly Japanese restaurant run by Sri Lanka's top chef Dharshan Munidasa in the Galle Fort. The quality is reliable but not game-changing, and the prices are high.
address: Galle Dutch Hospital, Hospital Street, Galle Fort, Galle
directions: If you're entering the Galle Fort, it's quickest to go through the southern gate. Turn left onto Court Square and keep going, there's parking behind the Galle Dutch Hospital.  If you're coming through the center gate, take the detour down Church Street, turn onto Queens St and then through the square.
name: The Tuna & The Crab

description: Mayura Hotel serves great rice and curry on banana leaves, and excellent Jaffna crab.
directions: Sri Kathiresan Street is very near the Central Gold Market in Pettah, it's just a skip away from the Main Street roundabout. Walk down from that end and you'll find it on your right.
name: Mayura Hotel

description: Cafe Francais is the only and best French restaurant in Colombo. It's expensive but really high quality dining.
directions: It's at the top of Park Street Mews. From Dharmapala Mawatha, turn down Park Street across from Vihara Maha Devi Park. Do a bit of a loop around for parking.
name: Cafe Francais by Pourcel

description: The Spectrum, formerly known as the Coco Fresh Bar, is a small waffle bar at the Liberty Arcade. The waffles are quite ordinary but they do a solid Milo shake.
directions: From the Colpetty Junction turn right to Duplication Rd at the Liberty Roundabout. The Spectrum is on the ground floor of the new Liberty Arcade.
name: The Spectrum

description: Tasty home-cooked Jaffna style dishes - they do orders in bulk, so ideal for lunch or dinner parties.
name: My Sister's Kitchen

description: This home baker does cake jars, and jars full of all kinds of candy.
name: Candy Cakes

description: Affordable and pretty tasty office lunches, with free delivery.
address: 536/15, Wijesinghe Gardens,  Kotte Road, Pita Kotte
directions: It's delivery, so they come to you.
name: Infinity Cuisine

description: Sri Siam on W.A. Silva Mawatha is yet another new Thai restaurant. We had high hopes since it's run by Thai management, but the food just wasn't up to par.
directions: Sri Siam shares the premises with Curry Leaves which is located midway through W.A Silva Mawatha, just past Almaas (or before it, if you enter from Havelock Rd)
name: Sri Siam

description: Krishna is a good vegetarian spot for rice and curry and the likes at the Arcade. They're run by the same guys who run Mathura.
directions: The Arcade is before you get to BMICH, after the SLBC building, on your left. The entrance fountains opposite the post office are hard to miss. Inside, the food court is near where the fish tank floor is.
name: Krishna (Arcade Independence Square)

description: Lil' Orbits is an awesome place to go to for your sugar cravings. The prices are alright and the chocolate sauce is gold.
directions: Majestic City is just before the Bambalapitiya junction, opposite Lauries Road. Enter it and go down to the basement, Lil Orbits is on the far left corner of the food court.
name: Lil' Orbits (Majestic City)

description: Candle Light Hut is a pretty popular, affordable place for Pakistani biriyani, paratha and meat curries.
directions: It's not very far from Galle Road - a few minutes away from the Budhdhagosha School and Royal Sweet Mart.
name: Candle Light Hut

description: Indian Summer is a slightly expensive Indian restaurant, with a great ambience.
directions: It's a few minutes from Coffee Bean and Barista, and opposite the Saskia Fernando Gallery.
name: Indian Summer

description: Itsy Bitsy Cupcakes is another home baker and they're big on covering their cupcakes with huge dollops of icing.
directions: They deliver
name: Itsy Bitsy Cupcakes

description: Grand Beijing is another Chinese place around the Kollpity junction that serves up good, authentic dishes at affordable prices.
directions: Turn right at the Kollpity junction, pass the Liberty Cinema, and just after Dinemore you'll see the restaurant's big yellow board on your right.
name: Grand Beijing

description: Calorie Counter with its emphasis on healthy eating was one of the best new additions to Colombo's restaurant scene in 2015. Now they've gone a  step further and introduced a pretty comprehensive breakfast menu, most of it actually tastes pretty great.
directions: Calorie Counter is on Thimbirigasyaya, just up from Havelock Road. It's before the Fab on Siripa Rd, right opposite the Glory Swim Shop.
name: Calorie Counter

description: Health Factor is an awesome little restaurant in Kohuwala that cooks up very tasty but healthy meals - at great prices.
directions: The restaurant is in the same building as the High Octane Fitness Gym - near Lumala City and Kushmi, a few minutes away from the bridge.
name: Health Factor

description: Pho serves up simple and healthy Vietnamese food. It's not as flavorful as we'd like, but they're very new and we think they'll improve.
directions: Pho is on Thimbi between Havelock Road and Jawatta. It's actually in from the road a bit, right next to Calorie Counter.
name: Pho Vietnam

description: Dolce Italia is a new little bakery cum restaurant run by two Italians. They serve pastries and Italian favourites that are both authentic and affordable.
directions: The new location is on Skelton Road, just off Dickman's Road.
name: Dolce Italia

description: Jeorgie's is a new burger place in Nawala - the burgers are huge (and not so healthy), and the fruit smoothies are amaze.
directions: School Lane on Nawala Road is just past Keells Super and the Nawala Cemetery. Go in and you'll see a big board that says 'Fun Factory' on your left - walk in here to get to Jeorgie's.
name: Jeorgie's Healthy Style Food

description: Sherry Land is a restaurant and pub in Negombo that offers one of the best cocktail menus we've come across in recent times, with some good food to boot.
directions: Sherry Land is about half way down Porutota Rd, past the Jetwing Ayurveda Pavilion but before Jetwing Blue.
name: Sherry Land Restaurant & Pub

description: Tea Triumph is a very cosy tea lounge down Marine Drive - they've existed since 1940, and have a lovely range of quality, locally-brewn tea.
directions: When you're heading down Marine Drive towards Kollupitiya - it's right after Marina Casino and before Carlwil Place.
name: Tea Triumph

description: If you thought you'd tried the entire local burger monarchy, think again, cause we just found Burger Queen. It may not blow your mind, but they've got some interesting additions along with the usual favourites.
address: No. 98, Sri Saranankara Road, Kalubowila, Dehiwala
directions: Burger Queen is on Saranankara Rd before Sumandisi bakers, just past the Anjaneyar Temple turn off.
name: Burger Queen

description: Golden Dragon is the completely redone Taj take on Chinese cuisine. It has a stellar ambience and good food.
address: Taj Samudra, 25 Galle Face Center Rd, Colombo 3
directions: The Taj is across from Galle Face Green. When you enter the Taj, turn left and go out the doors. It's right there, just to your left.
name: Golden Dragon (Taj)

description: The snack bar at the Lifestyle Gym offers some very healthy drinks and wraps - also, yummy cookies.
directions: The Sri Lanka Tennis Association is near the Public Library and National Museum, at the top of Sir Marcus Fernando Mawatha if you're coming from Kollupitiya. Walk into the premises and down the corridor ahead, Lifestyle gym will be the first door on your right.
name: Lifestyle Gym Snack Bar

description: Saffron and Vanilla is a home baker with international experience - she makes some amazing date cookies, and runs cookery classes.
address: 91/16B, Midland Mawatha, Wattarappala Road, Mount Lavinia
directions: Wattarapala Road is just before Cargills Food City, on your right, if you're heading from Colombo to Mount. Go right in to the very end of the road and after De Silva Road, turn left. The house is at the end of this lane.
name: Saffron and Vanilla

description: Taste of Asia is a very affordable favourite on Galle Road for hoppers and Jaffna food.
directions: It's near the Wellawatte bridge and Savoy, right opposite St Peter's College.
name: Taste Of Asia

description: Kinjou is one of the oldest Chinese restaurants in Colombo. Their stuff is as Sri Lankanized as it gets, but it's just okay at best.
directions: Kinjou is on Amarasekara Mw, just off Havelock Road opposite the Henry Pedris Childrens Park.
name: Kinjou

description: Life Food is a low key health food stall that manages to keep things healthy and fresh while not compromising on flavour.
directions: Life food is located at the Good Market shop in Lakpahana, which is just opposite the Colombo Racecourse building.
name: Life Food

description: Basically a place to have tea with a sweet Japanese auntie. They also sell well-chosen tea leaves. No food unless she gives you a biscuit.
directions: This is on a tiny residential lane off of Kynsey Road, near the De Saram Rd. junction. You can either come De Saram near the National Hospital/Central Hospital or go all the way down Kynsey. Once you pass De Saram it's the first unnamed street (should say 3-17). Walk down and look for 3-14. There's a teddy bear inside.
name: Euphorium

description: Saffron is a popular Iranian stall at Thursday's Good Market in Battaramulla. They serve some great Persian favourites, both sweet and savoury.
address: Nuga Tree Car Park, Colombo Racecourse, Colombo 07
directions: The Good Market is in the car park almost right behind the Racecourse mall. You can't miss the green tents, just look around for this stall.
name: Saffron Persian Delights (Good Market)

description: Jeewa's is a great place at the Good Market to have some proper Sri Lankan wraps, roast paan or roti, for cheap.
address: Nuga Tree Car Park, Colombo Racecourse, Colombo 07
directions: The Good Market is in the car park almost right behind the Racecourse mall. You can't miss the green tents, just look around for this stall.
name: Jeewa's Polos and Kuma's Natural Foods

description: House of Biriyani is a new biriyani delivery and take out in Kalubowila. They offer good value for money along with a solid roast chicken, but they also have room for improvement.
name: House Of Biriyani

description: Bombay Sweet Park is a small easily accessible shop in Bamba that does very good samosas and milkshakes - they've also got sweets and rice and curry.
address: 225, Visakha Road (at the Galle Road end), Galle Road, Colombo 04
directions: Visakha Road is almost opposite Holy Family Convent and parallel to Pilawoos. This shop is right at the top of this lane if you're coming in from Galle Road.
name: Bombay Sweet Park (Bambalapitiya)

description: Barista is the biggest coffee shop franchise in Colombo. Though their Laksala branch is just as so-so as the others in terms of food and drinks, it's got a lovely park-like ambience.
directions: It's at the end of a long lane (marked by 'Barista' and 'Laksala' signboards), nextdoor to Nelum Pokuna Theatre, opposite Viharamahadevi Park.
name: Barista Lavazza (Laksala Museum Gallery Cafe)

description: Dodol is a difficult dessert to find easily in Colombo shops - so we were ecstatic to find one that not only makes some but delivers dodol to your home.
name: The Dodol House

description: Foodie Adventure is a home cook in Nawala that does take away and delivery. We tried a bunch of her stuff and pretty much all of it was amazing. Which isn't something we say often.
directions: Foodie Adventure  is Malwatta Rd, off Nawala Rd just a bit past the Machan.
name: Foodie Adventure

description: Harpo's has a new stand-alone pizza parlor in Nugegoda. Almost by default it's one of the nicer places in that town now, and it makes for faster delivery to the suburbs - from Kotte to Battaramulla.
directions: The branch is near the Jubilee Post Roundabout. From Nugegoda, take the main road past the Nugegoda Supermarket towards Kotte. At a fork in the road (where Meat Locker is) turn right. Continue on that road for a few kilometers.
name: Harpo's Pizza (Nugegoda)

description: Expensive, but probably the most modernist Sri Lankan cuisine you can get.
directions: From Dharmapala Mawatha, head down Park Street and past Park Street Mews and Cafe Francais. It's just before the roundabout.  You can also get to the roundabout from the Gangaramaya Temple side.
name: rare at Residence (Uga Residence)

description: Brownie Lovin' is one of Colombo's awesome brownie bakers. The brownies are extremely gooey and chocolatey, and affordable.
directions: Harischandra Mw is off Havelock Road, near the end of WA Silva Mw, opposite St Peter's Church. Once you enter the road, the house is in the first by-lane on your left.
name: Brownie Lovin'

description: Ashik was once a popular choice amongst the YAMU staff for their rice and curry. Our latest visit left a negative impact on us though, and here's why.
directions: Ashik is on Duplication Rd, just past the Laugfs office, opposite Cafe Orange Peel
name: Ashik

description: Tammy is a Colombo home baker that specializes in some unconventional cakes. Her repertoire includes bibikkan, love cake and juggery cake, all of which were excellent.
directions: Tammy's is down Haig Rd (closer to the Marine Drive end), right next to the Indian Chaat Corner.
name: Tammy's

description: Mango & Company is yet another new home baker. What sets M & G apart is their cinnamon rolls which are some of the best we've had in Sri Lanka.
name: Mango & Company

description: Aside from their buffet, OZO actually has a pretty good a-la carte menu with an interesting range of dishes from burgers to steak.
directions: You'll find Clifford Place next to Chariot on Galle Road - turn into it and you'll find OZO at the very end on your right on Marine Drive.
name: EAT (OZO Colombo)

description: Thai Heritage is one of the many chic little restaurants on the foyers of the Old Dutch Hospital building in the Galle fort. The food though not striving for authenticity, is still alright, and somewhat on par with most fancy diners in the fort.
address: 1st Floor, 10-02, Old Dutch Hospital, Hospital Street, Galle Fort, Galle
directions: You can get to the old Dutch Hospital building through different routes - one is through Queens Street. As you enter the Fort, turn left, into Church Street, then turn left again into Queens Street - keep going down this road till you reach the building.
name: Thai Heritage (Galle Dutch Hospital)

description: Galle Caterers are one of the older caterers in Colombo with quite a large customer-base. We've tried their stuff on numerous occasions and they offer great value for money on top of consistent taste.
directions: Turn to Kadawatha Road from Hill Street and keep on it for a bit less that 1 km.  Galle Caterers is opposite the Vishnu Kovil Road.
name: Galle Caterers

description: Coffee Bean is slowly turning into Colombo's next Barista - this is the third branch to pop up in the city at another very central location. The coffee and food here taste alright and are pricey as usual, and it's a comfy quiet place to chill out at.
address: First Floor, Liberty Plaza Podium, Colombo 3
directions: This is on the 1st floor of the Liberty Plaza Podium - you can get here directly via escalator. The Podium is a big glass extension of the old Liberty Plaza building, which is right opposite Liberty Cinema. You need to turn right from Galle Road at the Kollupitiya junction to get here.
name: The Coffee Bean & Tea Leaf (Liberty Plaza Podium)

description: Flavoured at Cinnamon Red, with their lean luxury theme, offers a curated menu with good variations at reasonable prices. They've got a good view of Colombo, tasty mains and excellent desserts, albeit with slightly slow service.
directions: Red is at the end of Green Path (Nelum Pokuna Road), at the corner of Flower Road. If you go further down the road you hit Liberty Plaza. It doesn't look like it, but it has plenty of parking.
name: Flavoured (Cinnamon Red)

description: Really tasty burgers, but not cheap.
directions: Nordic House is near Chaaya Tranz, before Mambo's on the Galle Road. It's NOT where Google Maps say it is. From Colombo
name: Nordic House (Hikkaduwa)

description: A simple home cook that serves shelled crab - a real pleasure to eat.
directions: Delivery
name: Dilan's Crab

description: Trainspotter at Global Towers is one of the few restaurants that's open 24 hours a day. Unfortunately, the entire experience is mediocre at best.
address: 11, Global Towers Hotel, Marine Drive, Wellawatta, Colombo 06
directions: Global Towers is on Marine Drive, just a few meters past the KFC (next to Charlemont Road).
name: Trainspotter (Global Towers Hotel)

description: Fresheta is a small juice bar at the top of Chithra Lane. They serve up some refreshing, tasty juices which really hit the spot on a scorching day.
directions: Fresheta is at the very top of Chithra Lane, as you turn in from Kirula Road.
name: Fresheta

description: Anilana is one of Pasikuda's big beachside hotels. They've got killer ambience late in the evening, and they do a very good Jaffna crab curry.
name: Anilana Pasikuda (Restaurant)

description: Amaya is one of the big hotels on Pasikuda bay. It's huge, and though looks-wise is a little old school, is still incredibly efficient and ideal for some holiday pampering.
name: Amaya Beach Pasikuda

description: The Coffee Bar by the Grand Hotel is probably the best coffee shop in Nuwara Eliya. They've got a chic little space and an accessible location to go along with some good food and great coffee.
directions: Turn into Grand Hotel Rd from the Victoria Park roundabout and make your way up about 100m. The Coffee Bar is next to the Grand Indian, just past Hotel Glendower.
name: Coffee Bar (Grand Hotel, NE)

description: The Ceylon City Hotel is one of the newer new age hotels in Colombo. It's got good facilities at decent prices.
directions: When passing Visaka Road on Galle Road look to your left. Upatissa Road is the second lane on your left.
name: The Ceylon City Hotel

description: Schakasz is a little cafe in Kirulapone exclusively for desserts. They've got everything from creme brulee to chocolate ganache cake, in large portions.
directions: It's right next to the Stratford Avenue Barista, before Cafe Che - look for light teal canopies.
name: Schakasz

description: Poonie's Kitchen is a wonderful hidden oasis in the Galle Fort. They serve high quality desserts and deliciously prepared dishes at surprisingly good prices.
directions: This is just a few feet from Pedlar's Inn Cafe - you have to walk through two sets of doors (through the Mimimango shop) to get to Poonie's.
name: Poonie's Kitchen

description: Rripe is an okay juice bar that offers juices and fruits that are locally grown.
directions: Turn into Marine Drive from Galle Road onto Carlwil Place. Ripe is just there after the turn to the right.
name: Rripe Juice Bar

description: Praneetha is a small eatery that serves up a great rice and curry with the option of every kind of meat, from prawns to pork.
directions: From the junction where Perahara Mawatha meets Hudson Road just walk into Hudson Road a few feet and turn left from the junction in to Muhandiram's Road and you'll find it on the left.
name: Praneetha

description: The Anna Marie Bakery sounds like a place from a Beatrix Potter book. The food might as well be from the books too.
directions: Since pick-up is from her home I reckon you call her and get the address
name: Anna Marie Bakery

description: The Colombo Cafe  is a new competitor in Colombos cafe square off. While the prices of sandwiches and shakes can put your wallet on the endangered list, their Sri Lankan Buffet deal is the best deal weve come across.
directions: Where Lotus Road meets York Street, turn left onto Chatham St. These guys are next to the Dilmah T House.
name: The Colombo Cafe

description: Grand Thai is a relatively new Thai restaurant which resides at the former basement of The Grand Hotel. Taking the experience as a whole, we were very impressed. Good food, beautiful interior and some impeccable service.
directions: Turn into Grand Hotel Rd from the Victoria Park roundabout and make your way up about 100m. Grand Thai is located in the basement of The Grand Hotel.
name: Grand Thai (Grand Hotel, NE)

description: Navratna, the Taj's Indian restaurant, is one of the few great places in the city for an authentic Indian dining experience.
address: 25, Taj Samudra Hotel, Galle Face Center Road, Colombo 3
directions: Taj is right opposite Galle Face. Walk into the main lobby and turn into the corridor on your right to get to Navratna.
name: Navratna (Taj)

description: Curry Leaf is the Hilton's Sri Lankan restaurant, and their spread of local cuisine and fresh seafood is top notch. If you can afford the taxes, this is a must try.
directions: Past Galle Face Green, turn right at the Kingsbury roundabout and pass Galadari. You'll see Hilton on your left as you head towards Fort.
name: Curry Leaf (Hilton)

description: Royal Bakery is an old timer from Colombo's original bakery scene, going way back to 1906. The shorteats and cakes are still pretty good, and they've expanded to serving rice and kottu too.
directions: It's right next to No Limit, opposite St Lawrence Road.
name: Royal Bakery

description: Room Service is one of the more efficient delivery services around. Their delivery charges are higher than most others but they deliver from some high profile restaurants that you can't get otherwise.
name: Room Service Deliveries

description: The Sawadee , a part of Mount Breeze Hotel offers reliable food and service at reasonable prices.
address: 22/5A, Mount Breeze Hotel, Off De Saram Road, Mount Lavinia, Colombo
directions: You can head to the bottom of  Off De Saram Road (The name of the road is actually Off De Saram) , or settle to walk along to the beach. The beachfront restaurant is passed La Voile Blanche and before (RIP) Lavinia Breeze.
name: Sawadee (Mount Breeze Hotel)

description: Family Baker is arguably the best mainstream bakery in Mount Lavinia. They've got a great selection of both savories and sweets, which have been consistently tasty time and time again.
directions: From Colombo, head down the Galle Road till you get to Mount Lavinia (passing No Limit, the cemetery). Family Baker is at Family Super, which is right opposite the Lion Pub.
name: Family Baker

description: Kiri Kade, which humbly began as a milk delivery service is one of the most well established milk delivery services we know of. They still deliver and their milk is still fresh and flavoursome.
directions: Head down Duplication Road and pass the St. Peter's Sports Complex. Turn left when you cross the canal. The shop should be fifty metres down.
name: The Fresh Milk Shop (Kiri Kade)

description: This is truly a chill spot with beanbags, good food, decent WiFi and really smart and friendly staff.
directions: It's on the main road in Ella, past the rail tracks and just before Dream Cafe.
name: Cafe Chill

description: Flower Gate is a new and very welcome addition to the Sri Lankan Chinese food scene. They may be relatively unknown, but theirs was some of the best Chinese we've had in a while.
address: 2, Victoria Place, Elivitiala Mawatha (Baseline Rd), Colombo 8
name: Flower Gate

description: The Gardenia is Hotel Ramada's main restaurant, and they do a wide range of cuisines, from Italian to Jaffna, that are good value for money.
address: Ground Floor, No. 30, Sri Mohamed Macan Marker Mawatha, Colombo 3
directions: Take the right turn at the Galle Face roundabout (right after Inn On The Green), and Ramada will be on your right. Walk straight in to the end of the lobby to reach the restaurant.
name: The Gardenia Coffee Shop (Ramada)

description: La Langousterie is a beachside restaurant in Mount Lavinia that's pretty difficult to find. It's not the most sophisticated spot as far as ambience goes, but they offer a varied menu and some decent seafood dishes.
directions: La Langousterie is on Mount Beach at the far end. It's basically the closest restaurant to the Mount Lavinia Hotel on the beach.
name: La Langousterie

description: BreadTalk has been doing well since its inception despite all the its-expensive! cries, but anything for a posh pastry, right?
directions: Head down Park Street and pass Park Street Mews and Crown. BreadTalk is at the confusing roundabout to your right. Turn into the car park and head all the way down.
name: BreadTalk (Park Street)

description: Indramalee is a little buth kade on Union Place that does good rice and curry and fruit juices.  It's not much for ambience but the fare is reliable.
directions: It's just on the left side of Hilton Residencies.
name: Indramalee

description: FLOW is a restaurant at the Hilton Residences that serves up  a variety of international and local cuisines.
directions: HCR is next to Staple Street down Union Place. You have to walk into the Staple Street side entrance of the hotel to get to FLOW.
name: FLOW (Hilton Colombo Residences)

description: Waves is so good Id rather it be a secluded seafood jewel tucked at the bottom of Fairline road. The portion are generous and the fares are reasonable.
directions: Leg it to the bottom of Fairline Road till you come to a dead end at the railway tracks. It should be on the shore to your right.
name: Waves

description: Macky's is a decent choice for big portions and sloppy, spicy Sri Lankan Chinese, pastas and meats.
directions: It's past the Kirulapone market, opposite the Jumma Mosque.
name: Macky's Restaurant

description: Tatlers Tea is the usual YAMU tea break spot. It really isn't anything to write home about, but if you visit you just might bump into us!
directions: Head down Vajira Road and onto Duplication. Continue down Duplication- Tatlers is just before the turn off on Visakha Road to your  right.
name: Tatlers Tea

description: Mount Grill is an old restaurant in Mount Lavinia that serves a lot of Sri Lankan favorites. The place looks pretty run down now, but the food is actually quite good, especially some of their meat dishes.
directions: Mount Grill is on Galle Road, past the Mount Lavinia Cemetery, just before the IOC gas station.
name: Mount Grill

description: CocoCeylon is a mysterious business that we spotted only on Instagram. They offer overpriced smoothies and chia puddings.
name: CocoCeylon

description: Zephyr is a branch of the Mirissa spot. They do quite good food and drinks here.
address: Siam View Hotel, Panama Road, Arugam Bay
directions: Zephyr is literally tucked behind Siam House near the curve of Panama Road, before Main Point. It's after Gecko.
name: Zephyr (Arugam Bay)

description: Sea Fish is a restaurant that's been around since the '70s, and its dining space still features music and lights from that era. Their seafood is however good, and they also do seafood BBQs in their backyard on request.
address: 15, Sir Chittampalam A. Gardiner Mawatha, Colombo 2
directions: You'll find it down a small lane right next to Regal Cinema, a little walk away from Lake House.
name: Sea Fish Restaurant & Bar

description: &Co is a new pub and restaurant tucked in the Steuart Hotel behind Dutch Hospital. They serve up good, hefty pub fare in a spacious setting.
address: 45 Janadhipathi Mw, Colombo 1 (entrance on Hospital Ln)
directions: Walk through Dutch Hospital, exit past Barefoot and Taphouse, and the hotel will be immediately on your left. From Chatham Street, you can turn down Hospital Lane. Parking is hit or miss. Honestly, take a cab.
name: & Co. (The Steuart)

description: The Dhawalagiri is a typical saivar kadey, where you can drop in to get a quick, oily bite. It's in central Maradana, you can't miss it.
address: 433, P de S Kularatne Mawatha, Colombo 10
directions: It's  just past the Maradana Police Station
name: Dhawalagiri Hotel

description: The Cake is a bakery-cum-mini confectionery outlet located at The Kingsbury. It offers baked goodies and chocolates.
directions: The Kingsbury is right at the end of Galle Face before you turn towards Pettah. Once you enter the lobby, walk right down to the end onto your right, and you'd come to The Cake.
name: The Gourmet Station (The Kingsbury)

description: We all like the occasional slice of unorthodox pizza. But is Pizza Hut really worth the buck you're paying for it? Somewhat.
directions: Head down Attidiya Road from Bakery Junction. It's about a kilometre away.
name: Pizza Hut (Attidiya)

description: Royal Burger is a very reliable stop on Havelock Road for cheese dripping, affordable burgers and subs. It's a popular lunch option among the RI students in the neighborhood.
directions: This is right opposite Royal Institute, near Havelock City.
name: Royal Burger

description: Wonderbar is a sweet-toothed vegan's dream come true. They offer you gluten, sugar, and dairy-free desserts and smoothies,
directions: Opposite the Colombo Racecourse, enter Lakpahana and you'll find the Good Market outlet. Wonderbar products are available there.
name: Wonderbar

description: Seoul is a bright, sunlit, spanking new addition to the (mostly cheerless) Korean restaurants in the city.
directions: Right before the Lakshman Kadirgamar Institute when you're heading down Horton Place towards Nelum Pokuna
name: Seoul

description: Chop Chop does tasty, generous kottu all day, via drive through or delivery. Win.
directions: Chop Chop is part of Gonuts, which is at the corner of Horton Place and Kynsey Road. You can enter via Kynsey Road from the  north side or via Horton Place heading east, out of Colombo.
name: Chop Chop Kottu

description: A YAMU office favourite, Amirthaa in Bamba does a mean Ghee dosa. It also serves Bonda, Jelebi and fresh milk with a dash of tea.
directions: It's on Galle Road, land side, right after you pass the Vajira Road turn-off and the Kovil.
name: Hotel New Amirthaa

description: The Cake Factory has opened a small cafe on 5th Lane that offers a slightly limited range of their cakes and desserts. The cakes were so-so, but their cheesecake was the real winner.
directions: Cake Factory is on 5th Lane, just a few metres past Cafe on the 5th.
name: The Cake Factory (5th Lane)

description: The Grand is a little coffee shop along the bustling  Colombo Road in Negombo. They serve really good drinks and some killer cheesecake for very decent prices.
directions: If you're heading towards Negombo from Colombo, it's a little way off Maris Stella College. There's a Ranjana's clothing store right opposite.
name: The Grand  Espresso Bar

description: Dolce Vita is a rustic and snug little Italian restaurant / cafe which serves everything from breakfast menus to snazzy drinks, pizzas and gelato.
directions: Few meters from Rodeo Pub, at the end of a small path. Look for their black sign on Poruthota Road.
name: Dolce Vita

description: The King Coconut has a tropical vibe  with its roof dotted with coconut fronds and bamboo fences all round. It's also very chilled out, with a great view of the sea and the wind whipping around.
directions: As you go north along the Puttalam-Colombo highway, keep to your left and turn to Porutota Road. Drive along Porutota Road until you pass the Jetwing Ayurveda Pavilions.  You'll find the King Coconut Family Restaurant a few metres away, on your left.
name: King Coconut

description: There's a McDonald's outside of Colombo as well.
directions: Drive along the Negombo Road until you pass Mabola. It's about a couple of kms from the Mabola Mosque  you can't miss those giant golden arches.
name: McDonald's (Welisara)

description: MoMo's has an extensive menu ranging from naans to lasagna to seafood and pastas. It has a nice, comfy interior, and is a vibrant space for families.
directions: Just past Peliyagoda, and right opposite the Nawaloka Playground in Oliyamulla. It's onto your left, you can't miss it.
name: MOMO

description: The Dining Room specializes in international buffets at Cinnamon Lakeside.
address: Cinnamon Lakeside, 115, Sir Chittampalam A.Gardiner Mawatha, Colombo 02
directions: It's just before the SL Air Force headquarters.
name: The Dining Room (Cinnamon Lakeside)

description: You'll be pleasantly surprised by the quality of the breads, biscuits and baked goods at this Jaffna bakery and cafe.
directions: The bakery is on Sivaprahasam Road, just down the road from an outlet of Cargills Food City.
name: Thinesh Bake House

description: Oshella is a home cook who specializes in chocolatey desserts. Literally everything we tried was excellent, but her eclairs in particular were the best we've had in Colombo.
name: Oshella

description: Crammed into a congested street in Pettah, Sri Suryas is an unassuming restaurant that serves a mean ghee dosa, among other things.
directions: Go down Bodhiraja Mawatha from the main road, and when you reach the Main Street roundabout at the end, turn into Sea Street. Keep going a few hundred metres past all the jewellery shops until you see the Kathiresan kovil on your left. Sri Suryas is situated right next to the temple, across the road from New Saraswati Cafe.
name: Sri Suryas

description: B's Delights is relatively new, having started up just a couple of months ago. They do cakey brownies with interesting twists.
address: Delivery or pick up from Dehiwela or Bambalapitiya
directions: It's delivery
name: B's Delights

description: Fab is one of the older and more established bakeries in town. The franchise is well known for its cakes.
directions: When you're driving out of Colombo on the Negombo road, it's just opposite Hemas Hospitals, and a little before the Hendala Junction.
name: The Fab (Wattala)

description: Serving both north and south Indian thalis in addition to a la carte dishes, this all-vegetarian eatery is authentic and affordable  two adjectives we love a little more than others.
directions: On Park Road, go straight past Jack Tree and Off the Hook, towards Havelock Town. The restaurant will be on your right.
name: Thalis

description: Have you tried Hopper Kottu? Mr. Kottu is the place to go.
address: No. 243, Thalawathugoda Road, Wijitha Pura, Pitakotte
directions: If you are coming on Atulkotte to Pitakotte road, you have to come  Pitakotte junction first. Then turn left &  keep going about 1km towards Thalawathugoda town.
name: Mr. Kottu Restaurant

description: From regulars like Nasi Goreng and Mee Goreng, this place also dishes out a pretty great beef rendang.
directions: You can find this almost right at the top of Vauxhall Street if you're coming from the Ibbanwala Junction side. Closest landmarks are APIIT, Hyde Park, and the Arpico Supercentre.
name: Far East Indonesian Cuisine

description: Try-hard decadence that's not worth your money. Faux fine dining.
directions: From the Nelum Pokune roundabout, turn onto Horton Place.
name: Grande Gourmet at Nirj's

description: Open from the crack of dawn till midnight, this is a great, clean rice-and- curry stop with quail on the menu.
directions: From Main Street, turn onto St John's Road and take a left onto Bankshall Street.
name: Hotel Bankshall

description: Cool Berry is where the Juice Bar used to be. Despite their name and the extensive range of juices and smoothies on the menu, they don't have half of it.
directions: If you're coming from Maradana towards Borella, take a right turn soon after passing Aquinas.
name: Cool Berry

description: Atrium is a Japanese/Fast Food restaurant in Thalawathugoda
directions: If you're on the Battaramulla - Pannipitiya Road, turn towards Madiwela from Thalawathugoda. Atrium will be about half a kilometre in, on your right, just at the start of the walking track.
name: Atrium Restaurant

description: Cookies and You claims to deliver Love at First Bite, and they live up to this promise. Their baked goods taste as great as their Instagram feed looks.
directions: Near Mondy.
name: Cookies & You

description: Coco V at Crescat offers the same stuff as the Coco V at Ward Place, but the ambience isn't as chilled out as the other. Their signatures are coffees and cakes.
address: G-09, Crescat Boulevard, Galle Road, Colombo 03
directions: It's on the same floor as the Vijitha Yapa Bookstore at Crescat  just outside, onto your right as you exit the building.
name: Coco Veranda (Crescat Boulevard)

description: Margie's Kitchen is a home cook in Mount Lavinia that specializes in Dutch Burgher and Portuegse influenced local dishes. While they offer a variety of dishes, most of it revolves around pork, and their briliant black pork curry is the coup de grace.
directions: Huludagoda Road is down Sri Gunerathne Mw off Galle Rd.  This isn't a restaurant so give them a call for the exact location for pick up.
name: Margie's Kitchen

description: Right on Marine Drive, Marrybrown is a cheaper option for fried chicken and burgers. They're generous with their mayo, and their chicken is all about the crispy skin.
directions: On Marine Drive, heading towards Colombo, pass the Kirulapone Canal and it's to your right.
name: Marrybrown

description: Authentic biryani at affordable prices, Seasons is only held back by its dismal setting on the deserted second floor of Liberty Plaza.
address: Liberty Plaza, Level 2, 250, R A De Mel Mawatha, Colombo 03
directions: Turn onto Duplication Road from the Liberty Plaza roundabout. Take the elevator to the second floor. It's to your right.
name: Seasons

directions: Turn right into Union Place from Lipton Circus (near Town Hall). It's almost right at the start, on your left. Parking is available but super limited.
name: Senkada Salaka Restaurant

directions: If you are coming on Galle road from Colombo side it's just 100m ahead from Panadura base hospital on your right hand side
name: Kamrose Restaurant (Panadura)

description: This saivar kade does some killer dishes and has earned street cred for being the best in Colombo.
directions: Drive straight along Armour Street and take a left at Messenger Street. It's almost as soon as you turn in.
name: Shri Vani Vilas

description: Tea Breeze is Mackwood's tea bar. They have decent teas, and good waffles.
address: GS 4, Ground Floor, Race Course Grand Stand, Reid Avenue, Colombo 07
directions: It's in the same building as the Amante Boutique. Right next to it, in fact.
name: Tea Breeze  (Racecourse)

description: London House of Coffee is a new coffee shop located on Gregory's Road serving Ceylon Coffee - roasted in-house.
name: London House of Coffee

description: Kate Ryori is a homecook in Colombo that serves up tasty Japanese cuisine at affordable prices with some pretty filling portions to boot. It's a tiny operation, but she's pretty much the only Japanese homecook we know of and it's a great change-up from the usual Japanese restaurants.
directions: She's a home cook so directions will be given once orders are placed.
name: Kate Ryori

description: Dwaraka is a new pure vegetarian Indian restaurant in Bambalapitiya. Although we ran into a few hiccups, we still walked away pleased with our meal.
directions: Dwaraka is basically on Marine Drive, right at the turn off to Jaya Road.
name: Dwaraka

description: The longstanding 88 Chinese Restaurant has opened up a branch in Dehiwela, serving most items except for all pork dishes.
directions: It's on the seaside, just after you pass Cargills.
name: 88 Restaurant (Dehiwela)

description: Rasa Sayang is a new Indian take-out restaurant on Hill St, run by the same management as The Malay Restaurant.
directions: Rasa Sayang is on Hill Street,  about 500m up from the Dehiwala Junction, just before Cafe Asiana.
name: Rasa Sayang Indian Food

directions: It's between the P & S and Sampath Bank, just before Thalawathugoda junction when travelling from Pelawatte
name: Alumka Caterers (Thalawathugoda)

description: Park Street Trattoria is the newest addition to Park Street's fancy repertoire of restaurants. They've got a beautiful space, but the food has definite room for improvement.
directions: From Vihara Maha Devi (along Dharmapala Mawatha) turn down Park Street. If you go all the way to the roundabout and turn left there's parking.
name: Park Street Trattoria

directions: The Fab's on Galle Road, right across from the main gates of Prince of Wales Collage, Moratuwa
name: The Fab (Moratuwa)

description: They have okay-ish food, and have an Arabian-Nights-esque deco going on, but have room for vast improvement.
address: Galadari Hotel, Ground Level, Fort, Colombo 01
directions: Cut straight across the lounge, passing a couple of other restaurants and seating areas. This is right at the back of the hotel.
name: Sheherazade Arabic Restaurant (Galadari)

description: The Governor's Restaurant at the Mount Lavinia Hotel is one of the few hotel restaurants that offers real value for money with their dishes.
directions: Coming down Galle Road, turn to Hotel Road (the road that leads down from ODEL), Mount Lavinia hotel is at the very end. Pretty hard to miss.
name: Governor's Restaurant (Mount Lavinia Hotel)

description: Sushi Kai is the new Japanese restaurant that's taken up the former location of Kami Maki. It may look familiar, but they fall well short when it comes to flavour and quality.
directions: Sushi Kai is at the Jawatte Road junction in Thimibirigayaya, right opposite the Church of the Good Shepherd.
name: Sushi Kai

description: A home-cook that's make seasonal Christmas pudding.
directions: Bullers Lane is opposite Rupavahini. If you're coming down Bauddhaloka, you pass Arcade Independence and then turn just before Torrington. Christine's is a house just past Aura, on the opposite side.
name: Christine's

description: Elite's been around Colombo for years, but now they've expanded their service to Wattala as well. They serve Chindian (Chinese and Indian) food.
directions: It's onto your left soon after you pass the Mabola Mosque, if you're heading towards Negombo.
name: Elite (Wattala)

description: China Manor is a new hotel in Maradana with an authentic Chinese restaurant. Their crispy chicken is amazing.
directions: It's right next to CineCity.
name: China Manor

description: A new place which specializes in biscuit puddings.
directions: Joseph Lane is near the Bamba Junction. Turn in and go towards Junior George's. Call them for pickup directions.
name: The Pudding Stop

description: Having been around since 2002, Barista is one of the first coffee shops to have popped up in Colombo.
directions: It's right opposite the UN at the Thummulla Junction, sharing the same land as Laksala.
name: Barista Lavazza (Laksala Thummulla)

description: A lawyer's chambers turned Moroccan/Italian restaurant, they do their own take on moussaka, hummus and baba ghanoush.
directions: From the Fort entrance, take Church Street and keep going. Pass the Church, pass the Commercial Bank, and it'll be to your left.
name: Chambers

description: You can buy tea powder or tea leaves here, as well as sit down and have a cuppa. They've also got a small selection of pastries at times.
directions: It's right at the end of Haig Road, more towards Marine Drive.
name: Blue Field Tea Centre

description: Serves coffee, frappes, shakes, and a bunch of baked goodies.
directions: It's right near 5th Lane. Landside on Galle Road.
name: The Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf (Galle Road)

description: They're supposed to be a tea room, but they serve rice & curry, lamprais and other random stuff.
directions: Liberty Arcade is just a few metres past Liberty Plaza on Duplication Road. Townhouse is on the ground floor.
name: Townhouse by &Co

description: An attic converted into a cafe, The Stairway is a new spot in the Fort run by a resident. Good rice and curry.
directions: Take Church Street from the Fort entrance and keep going and pass Pedlar Street. It'll be to your left.
name: The Stairway

address: No. 42, D. S. Senanayake mawatha, Boerlla, Colombo 08
directions: Next door of NoLimit
name: Sri Ariyabawan Hotel (Borella)

description: Flow Health Bar is a vegan health food stall in Ward Place that serves up a range of salads and healthy juices. Their stuff is undoubtedly healthy; however, their menu can be a bit confusing and their food just wasn't as flavoursome as we hoped.
name: Flow Health Bar

description: A street with a wide variety of food in the center of industrial Colombo. Find everything from mutton brain curry to devilled cuttlefish eggs.
address: Abdul Hameed Street, between Quarry Road and Oilman's Street
directions: If you're going along Armour Street, turn left down Srimath Bandaranayake Mawatha and turn left
name: Hulftsdorp Streetfood

description: Food         .                    .
directions: Go on main road from Pelawaththa to Thalawathugoda. After passing Nagahamulla tank just go about 100m ahead. Wadi Food is on your right hand side.
name: Food (Pelawatta)

description: A homebaker based in heart of Colombo 7 who specializes in peanut butter jelly cookies.
address: 7 Barnes Place Residencies, Barnes Place, Colombo 07
directions: From Town Hall, head towards Nelum Pokuna and turn left onto Barnes Place. It's to your left.
name: Bakeology

description: One of the Fort's quintessential spots for accommodation and breakfast.
directions: It's right in the heart of the Fort, just next to the All Saints Church
name: Galle Fort Hotel

description: One of Negombo's long term dining institutions.
directions: It's on the main Negombo bar strip
name: Lords (Negombo)

description: Whipping up some mouthwatering Sri Lankan and Western/ Fusion cuisine, Kaduruketha's restaurant is elegant and mouthwatering.
directions: Drive straight along the Cmb-Batti Highway from the Wellawaya Junction, and then turn left at Aluth Paara. Take another left turn about 4kms in, and you're there.
name: Jetwing Kaduruketha (Restaurant)

description: KGN Burgers on Wheels is a food truck on Hill Street that serves up some surprisingly tasty burgers. It's only a two man operation, but it's very efficient, clean and they seem to be a hit with the folks.
directions: We found KGN just past Dharmarama Rd on Hill Street.
name: KGN Burgers on Wheels

description: With a great setting, decor and beautiful presentation, Chapter one disappoints when it comes down to execution.
address: 931C,  Ethul Kotte Road (Off Parliament Road), Ethul Kotte
directions: From Kotte Road, head towards Sri Jayawardenepura Mawatha, and it'll be to your left, just after the petrol station.
name: Chapter One

description: Considered the only proper dine-in experience in Batticaloa, their Indian food is pretty good.
directions: Head down Trinco Road from Kallady Bridge and it's to your right, just past Pan Asia Bank.
name: Tomato (Batticaloa)

description: A street-side eatery that does the best beef rottis in Batticaloa. Great for breakfast with plain tea.
name: Batticaloa Muslim Hotel

address: Thulasi Hotel, Udaya Raja mawatha, Badulla.
directions: If you are coming on Kings Street turn in to Udaya Raja mawatha which is on your right hand side. You can see Thulasi Hotel in front of you on the other side of the road.
name: Thulasi Hotel (Badulla)

address: Ella Village Inn, Down Town Rotti Hut, Ella
directions: Just walk 20m ahead from Ella town to Ella railway station side. Rotti hut will be on your right hand side.
name: Down Town Rotti Hut (Ella)

description: Which Way West is a new pub that serves up okay food.
address: 1st Floor, Liberty Arcade, 282, R. A. Re Mel Mawatha, Colombo 03
directions: From the Liberty junction, turn onto Duplication Road, it's at Liberty Arcade, which is just past Liberty Plaza.
name: Which Way West

description: A mix of authentic and Sri Lankanized Chinese food, run by the friendliest Chinese lady.
